datum.field: The design of public works projects such as buildings, bridges, roadways, railroads, sewers, gas and electric services, etc.

datum.name: Climbing
datum.field: The ability to climb things such as trees, buildings, walls, rock formations, ice, etc. This includes free climbing, and climbing with equipment.

datum.name: Communications
datum.field: The knowledge of basic communication such as hand signals and gesturing, as well as modern communications methods like telephone, radio, and computerized communicationand their associated equipment.

datum.name: Computer Programming
datum.field: The knowledge of how to write code for computers. This includes knowledge of programming languages, basic operation of the computer, and how to construct algorithms to solve problems. Computer programming implies the computer use skill. (you get computer use free with programming)

datum.name: Computer Use
datum.field: The ability to use a computer for work and pleasure. This includes how to perform simple computer-related tasks, such as setting up a computer, basic repairs, and how to use common softwarelike word processing, spreadsheets, image viewing, E-mail, and Internet browsing.

datum.name: Construction
datum.field: The knowledge of working on a construction site. This includes preparing a site for building, reading plansblueprints, surveying and laying a foundation, framing, and finishing a building or other structure. This also includes the use of common construction tools and heavy equipment including power tools, dump trucks, cement mixers, backhoes, and cranes. A person with this skill will also have experience with mixing concrete, laying bricks, and working with lumber and structural steelas well as SIMPLE plumbing, electrical, and carpentry tasks.

datum.name: Cooking
datum.field: The skill of preparing various dishes from scratch. A person with this skill will know many recipes, how to select and prepare ingredients, and how to cook and present a finished dish or meal. (Skill level 3 would be a professional Chef)

datum.name: Cryptography
datum.field: The study of codes, including how to create, identify, and break them.

datum.name: Cyber Medicine
datum.field: The study of cybernetics as they relate to the human body. People with this skill are knowledgeable about cybernetics, how they function, and how to design and modify or repair them. A person with this skill and the appropriate supplies can work on cyborgs.

datum.name: Dancing
datum.field: The ability to dance. Choose a particular type, such as Ballroom, Country and Western, Swing, etc.

datum.name: Deception
datum.field: Con artist, thief, crooked businessman, stage magician

The ability to hide the truth about something, or make things appear different than they really are, by talking about them. This is NOT lying outright, etc, but cleverly presenting the evidence to further your goal. This is usually achieved by downplaying or carefully ignoring some information while strategically emphasizing other points. Bending the truth, rationalizing things, etc, falls under this skill.

datum.name: Decorating
datum.field: How to decorate that is pleasing to the eye.

datum.name: Diplomacy
datum.field: The ability to negotiate and broker deals for business, political, and legal purposes. A person with this skill will know how to make compromises that best suit his goals, and will be able to deal with people in tense situations without angering them.

datum.name: Disguise
datum.field: Characters with Disguise know how to make themselves look like someone else. Either to copy the looks of another person or to just change the appearance of the character. This also includes the ability to detect if someone else is in disguise.

datum.name: Drink Mixing
datum.field: Knowledge of drinks, how to make them, etc.

datum.name: Electrical Engineering
datum.field: The academic skill of the design and function of electronics and electrical systems. A person with this skill would know how to design and analyze electronic devices.

datum.name: Electrician
datum.field: The practical knowledge of the electrical wiring of homes and buildings. A person with this skill will know about the electrical wiring in buildings, and how to repair and modify such things. This includes the use of related tools, and how to identify problems and parts.

datum.name: Electronic Warfare
datum.field: The knowledge of electronic technology such as communications jamming, stealth technology, ECM, ECCM, and related topics as applied to electronics in war or combat situations.

datum.name: Electronics
datum.field: The practical skill of building, troubleshooting, and repairing electronic devices. A person with this skill would have only basic knowledge of designing electronic devices, but they are skilled in repairing, modifying, and working on electronic items. This includes use of electronic tools such as test equipment, soldering gear, etc.

datum.name: Entertaining
datum.field: The skill of entertaining people by telling jokes, simple performances, and improvising. Being comfortable and at ease around people.

datum.name: Escape
datum.field: People with this skill have the ability to escape from bonds. This includes ropes, handcuffs, straight jackets, and similar restrictive bonds.

datum.name: Espionage/surveillance
datum.field: Military specialist, thief, detective, private investigator

The skills required to find out information by observing others and their actions. Includes techniques for watching people and listening in on their conversations, etc, from a distance. Also, how to set up stakeouts and use technology (cameras, bugs, etc) to perform these tasks falls under the scope of this skill.

datum.name: Faith
datum.field: The belief in a particular religion, God(s), or a spiritual philosophy. Note that this skill is true belief in that religion, not simply knowledge about it. This skill is use for Faith-type magic. See magic section for more details

datum.name: Falling
datum.field: The character knows how to fall from a fall distance. When falling, the character can roll his skill. He can fall 10 feet per success without taking damage. Beyond that, he takes the normal 16 per 10 feet.

datum.name: Farming
datum.field: Knowledge growing crops, harvesting, etc. Includes knowledge of raising common farm animals and working with farm equipment.

datum.name: Fashion
datum.field: Knowledge and selection of clothing and related items to maximize beauty, or to convey a particular image.

datum.name: Filmography
datum.field: The knowledge of how to make movies, commercials, and other video productions. Includes knowledge of directing, sets, working with actors, simple effects, and film editing.

datum.name: First Aid/Paramedicine
datum.field: Basic first aid treatment for various common injuries. Includes knowledge of basic medication, bandaging, treatment of wounds, stabilizing victims, and performing very simple medical procedures in the field. A successful use of this skill will stop a person below 0 hit points from losing any more, this takes a turn to attempt.

datum.name: Forensics
datum.field: Deducing the nature of a crime or other event based on evidence, especially minimal evidence. Taking and matching fingerprints, analyzing handwriting, notes, threats, study of weapons or other objects used in crimes, etc.

datum.name: Forgery
datum.field: The knowledge of how to forge signatures, documents, insignia, etc. and how to detect forged work.

datum.name: Gambling
datum.field: The knowledge of card and casino games, such as poker, blackjack, craps, baccarat, roulette, etc. This includes how to play the games, rules, the odds of winning, etc.

datum.name: Geology
datum.field: The academic study of the earth and its geological formationsincluding rocks, minerals, and related scientific elements. A person with this skill would know how to identify various geological features, including gems, etc.

datum.name: Glassblowing
datum.field: The art of glass-blowing. How to make, shape, and judge glass. How to make objects, and sculptures; things like idols, plateware, jugs, abstract art, etc. The ability to be artistic is governed by this skill. If the character also has blacksmithing, carpentry, etc. they can make their own tools, and forge. The ability to design new types of glass requires alchemy or chemistry.

datum.name: Graphic Arts
datum.field: The design and layout of printed matter, such as books, magazines, newspapers, and posters and advertising materials. Includes designing such works for maximum readability and visual impact, as well as the production of printed materials. This involves typesetting, production of master copies, operating a printing press, and desktop publishing on a computer.

datum.name: Gunsmithing
datum.field: The ability to design, repair, modify, and build handguns, shotguns, and rifles. A person with this skill cannot build a gun from scratch, but can build guns from raw parts, and is skilled in the modification and tuning of firearms.

datum.name: Hacking/Cracking
datum.field: The art of gaining access to computer systems and software by indirect means. This often includes breaking into secured systems or networks. Password cracking, enabling protected software, etc. falls under this skill.

datum.name: History
datum.field: Historical knowledge extending from the present until 5000 years in the past. Persons with this skill will know about major political figures (and other famous people), wars, famines, natural disasters, and major culturalscientificreligious events and discoveries made during that time.

datum.name: Hit Points
datum.field: Adds HitPoints to your character. You get two per CP spent.

datum.name: Holistic Medicine
datum.field: Non-traditional medicine, such as acupuncture, massage therapy, use of herbal drugs, etc. Choose a branch when selecting this skill (example

datum.name: Hunting
datum.field: The ability to locate, stalk, and kill game. This includes looking for game animals and signs of their presence, tracking, and techniques for stalking them. Also, using weapons (such as bows, firearms, spears, etc.) and traps to kill game, and how to butcher game in the field for meat and skins.

datum.name: Impersonation/Acting
datum.field: The skills of portraying a character or person other than oneself. Includes how to alter voice, habits and mannerismsas well as basic costuming, etc. in order to play the part. This skill is used for professional actors, and for espionage purposes.

datum.name: Inspire Emotion
datum.field: The ability to manipulate the emotions of others by interacting with them. Through verbal communication and body language, a person with this skill can cause others to become happy, sad, etc.

datum.name: Interrogation
datum.field: Extracting information or answers to specific questions from someone through various means. This might include deceiving the target, befriending them, convincing them, intimidation/blackmail, or even torture.

datum.name: Intuition
datum.field: Law enforcement, soldier, almost any other occupation

The ability to guess well in situations where a person is unsure about two or more options. A person with this skill tends to guess correctly between options more than statistics would predict. This skill can only be used if the character had some knowledge in the general area of the guess to be made.

datum.name: Investigation
datum.field: Gathering information about something or someone using the media, interviewing people, looking at firsthand accounts and other evidence, etc.

datum.name: Journalism
datum.field: Researching recent events and reporting on them concisely. This skill is common for newspapers and TV news station crews.

datum.name: Language
datum.field: The knowledge of a language. Possessing this skill implies proficiency of one language. Purchase this skill separately for each language a person knows. Higher levels imply greater proficiency, eloquence, and superior vocabulary. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.

datum.name: Leadership
datum.field: The ability to observe situations, prioritize activities related to them, and guide people through them. All characters under the leadership of someone with this skill may add X to each of their initiative numbers. (The person with the leadership skill may do this as well) X is the number of successes on the leadership roll.

datum.name: Leatherwork
datum.field: Working with leather and leather goods. This includes the tanning of leather, forming it into shapes (such as bags, pouches, saddles, clothing items, weapon sheaths, etc.), and sewing it into useable goods.

datum.name: Legal
datum.field: Knowledge of legal systems and how to use them.

datum.name: Literacy
datum.field: The ability to write and read a written language. Note that if you purchase Literacy and Language together (the same language) you may purchase Language as a LVL 1 skill.

datum.name: Literature
datum.field: The knowledge of well-known literature (famous works and authors), as well as general rhetoric and literary expression. Note that this is not the same thing as language, literacy, or writing.

datum.name: Lockpicking
datum.field: The knowledge of locks, how to open them without a key, and how locks (both simple and complex) operate. This includes the use of lock-opening tools such as picks, etc.

datum.name: Luck
datum.field: The maximum value of the characters Luck subattribute is increased by one.

datum.name: Lying
datum.field: Knowing how to tell a lie is a fine art, and this character knows it. The character can tell a convincing lie and to develop plausible alibis. This also allows the character to detect that someone else is lying.

datum.name: Machining
datum.field: The skills of metalworking. This includes how to operate common tools in a metalworking shop, as well as processes such as welding, flame cutting, etc. A person with this skill can read blueprints, and can produce parts and devices from metal given the proper equipment. This skill is also useful for repairing mechanical devices, such as vehicles, robots, and mecha.

datum.name: Magical Control
datum.field: This skill represents a magic user's ability to accurately control magic energy and make it do what she wants it to. See magic section for full information.

datum.name: Magical Studies
datum.field: The academic study of magic and related processes. A character may also use this skill to identify magical items (requires touching them). It also allows a character to read magical script such as that used in spell books.

datum.name: Mana Points
datum.field: How to add arbitrary mana points.

datum.name: Management
datum.field: The ability to manage people and resources in order to accomplish a certain task. This is primarily in business personnel, as well as military commanders, etc.

datum.name: Marine Piloting
datum.field: Knowledge of piloting a ship or boat. The knowledge of maritime laws, practices, and the general maintenance and operation of boats and ships fall under the scope of this skill.

datum.name: Martial Arts
datum.field: (See Martial Arts section) This is the governing skill of the Martial Arts subsystem. It represents the level of skill that a person has in martial arts. No person may posses a martial arts technique of higher rank than his or her level of martial arts.

datum.name: Materials Science
datum.field: The knowledge of various natural and processed substances and their uses and applications. This is a supporting skill for many engineering skills, etc.

datum.name: Mathematics
datum.field: Knowledge of mathematical theory and techniques for apply mathematics to real life situations.

datum.name: Mecha Electronics
datum.field: The electronics skill as applied to Mecha. This includes the design and modification of the electrical systems of mechs, including computers, sensors, and related components.

datum.name: Mecha Piloting
datum.field: The ability to operate a Mech. This skill is required in order for a character to operate a Mech. While piloting a mech, any DEX-based skill you want to use cannot have a higher level than this skill. See Mecha rules for more information.

datum.name: Mechanic
datum.field: The skills for performing maintenance, repair, and related work on cars, trucks, buses, and motorcycles. In short, just about any vehicle except aircraft and mecha.

datum.name: Mechanical Engineering
datum.field: The academic study of mechanical parts and systems. This includes such things as machinery, controls, structural design, etc. A person with this skill would be adept at designing mechanical things, and analyzing the designs of others. This skill does NOT imply the ability to make a mechanical device.

datum.name: Medical
datum.field: Professional medicine. The study of the human body, its ailments, and how to treat them. Lvl 1 = Pre-Med Student, Lvl 2 = Med School GraduateResident, Lvl 3 = Inexperienced MD. You may choose the area of expertise

datum.name: Medical Emergency
datum.field: The ability to fix wounds 'in the field'. This can be done as a standard action.

datum.name: Military Strategy
datum.field: The strategic deployment and command of troops, tanks, ships, and other units in war, police, security, and similar situations.

datum.name: Mining
datum.field: The ability to correctly assess the ability to mine a large, long, deep tunnel. How to go about digging the tunnel, and all the logistics and equipment needed for the mine.

datum.name: Music
datum.field: The ability to play an instrument. Select what instrument when you pick this skill. This implies the ability to read music.

datum.name: Mythology
datum.field: The knowledge of the myths, superstitions, and religious beliefs of past civilizations. This can be generic overall knowledge, or specific and in-depth in one particular area.

datum.name: Navigation
datum.field: How to plot and plan directions and courses in natural settings.

datum.name: Pharmacology
datum.field: The dispensing, dosage calculation, and selection of drugs. How to make pills or liquid medicines (from the raw medicine), and the knowledge of what existing drugs work for what ailments; knowledge of combined effects from mixing drugs, etc.

datum.name: Philosophy
datum.field: Study of any particular type of philosophy or outlook on life (or general knowledge of several). Academic skill.

datum.name: Photography
datum.field: The skills associated with taking pictures. The selection and operation of cameras (still and video), use of lenses and filters, taking pictures in various different conditions, working with film, as well as developing and editing prints.

datum.name: Physics
datum.field: The academic study of natural laws, including mechanics, electricity and magnetism, optics, etc. The study of how and why things act the way they do.

datum.name: Plumbing
datum.field: The repair and installation of piping, drains, and fixtures (sinks, bathtubs, water heaters, etc.) in and around buildings. Includes working with piping, fittings, etc. for both water and gas use.

datum.name: Politics
datum.field: Affinity for politics; knowledge of the political process, political groups and their agendaspublic and private. The knowledge of current political events, deal making, vote gathering, and lobbying fall under this scope of this skill.

datum.name: Psionic Studies
datum.field: The academic study of Pisioncs; including how psionic powers work, what they do, and what their limitations are. This skill is NOT required to use psionic abilities.

datum.name: Riding
datum.field: Riding an animal. Select the type of animal for the skill. Common examples are horses, camels, elephants, etc. This skill can be taken for any riding animal. The skill also includes basic care, grooming and feeding of the animal.

datum.name: Robotics
datum.field: The scientific knowledge and practical engineering experience associated with working on robots. Much like how a mechanic works on cars, a person with robotics is skilled at working on robots. This includes designing robots (greatly aided with mechanical and electrical engineering), and repairing or modifying them.

datum.name: Ropes and Rigging
datum.field: Tying knots, working with ropes and cables for purposes of lifting and securing loads, etc. Sailors, dockworkers, crane crews, truckers, climbers, etc commonly possess this skill. Persons with this skill know what knots to use when and how to tie them. Also gives the character the knowledge on the suitability of ropes and cables for different applications.

datum.name: Rune Magic
datum.field: The academic study of rune magic. No character may learn a rune spell of higher rank than his level of this skill. (See Rune Magic system...)

datum.name: SCUBA Diving
datum.field: The knowledge of how to use assist equipment for underwater diving. This includes SCUBA systems, air tanks, surface compressors, diving suits, and related devices. Persons with this skill will know how to avoid decompression sickness, how to communicate underwater by means of signals, and how to recover small to mid-sized objects underwater.

datum.name: Sailing
datum.field: Knowledge of sailboats and how to sail them. This includes setting up and working with sails and rigging, steering, etc. A person with this skill will have basic navigation knowledge, and knowledge of maritime laws.

datum.name: Sales
datum.field: The ability to sell something. A person with this skill will be adept at marketing and promotion of goods and services, finding buyers, negotiating prices, etc.

datum.name: Scrounging
datum.field: Knowledge of how and where to look for items, but not from 'normal' sources. People with this skill are known for their ability to find just about anythingeven if that means digging around in dumpsters, pawnshops, and similar locations.

datum.name: Security
datum.field: The knowledge of how to protect persons, objects, and places. This includes use of security systems, surveillance equipment, and guard personnel. A person with this skill knows how to use these measures to protect things, and also recognizes their weaknesses, as well as common tactics used to breach them.

datum.name: Seduction
datum.field: The use of oneself to make other people to do what they want. This might include faking friendship or romantic interest, deceptive speech, and use of physical attractiveness.

datum.name: Singing
datum.field: The ability to sing. This can be any type of music. This skill implies the ability to read music.

datum.name: Sleight of Hand
datum.field: This skill includes things such as stage magic, palming things, concealment, etc. A person with this skill can perform various card tricks, other magic tricks, and would be skilled at palming objects, or making objects 'appear' from thin air. This could be used for tricks, stealing small objects, or concealing small weapons.

datum.name: Smithing
datum.field: The art of working with metal with primitive techniques. Persons with this skill are experienced at forming metal with a forge, hammer, and anvil. This skill can be used to make simple tools, weapons, and other goods.

datum.name: Spellcasting
datum.field: The skill of casting magical spells, invocation style. You cannot purchase a spell whose rank is higher than your level of this skill. It provides additional MP as well. See magic section for full information.

datum.name: Stealth
datum.field: Stealth gives the character the ability to move silently through his or her surroundings.

datum.name: Streetwise
datum.field: The knowledge of how the streets 'work'; things like cants, where to find contacts, etc.

datum.name: Summoning
datum.field: A variant of magic applied to calling forth animals and various creatures to assist the caster. See the Summoning Magic text for more information.

datum.name: Supernatural Lore
datum.field: The knowledge of little known or unusual mythology, especially that involving ghosts, monsters, undead, werewolves or vampires, etc. A person with this skill will have knowledge of various mythical (and real) beasts, monsters, etc. including their appearance, strengthsweaknesses, etc.

datum.name: Survival
datum.field: The ability to find food, water, and shelter in most any situation. Includes making simple shelters (lean-tos, tents, stick houses, etc.), making a fire, collecting food and water, and avoiding harm from the elements (extreme temperatures), dangerous animals, etc.

datum.name: Swimming
datum.field: Similar to Athletics, but specifically swimming and diving skills. Imparts the endurance and techniques to swim long distances, etc.

datum.name: Teaching
datum.field: The ability to teach skills you know to others.

datum.name: Theology
datum.field: The knowledge of religion and how to argue about religion. Non-historical in nature.

datum.name: Throwing
datum.field: Throwing things with accuracy and power. This could be a rock, baseball, grenade, or whatever. A person with this skill can throw things much more accurately and further than a normal person. (Note, this skill can be used in combat to strike with grenades or similar thrown weapons. However, throwing knives, shuriken, etc. are a different skill)

datum.name: Tracking
datum.field: The ability to follow something (animal, person, or vehicle) based on the signs it left behind. This includes such things as identifying and following tracks, finding hidden or covered tracks, and how to disguise tracks.

datum.name: Trivia
datum.field: The knowledge of unusual or generally useless facts like obscure history, sports stats, info about actors and actresses, etc. This is the kind of knowledge one would need to do well at trivia games, like Trivial Pursuit and Jeopardy.

datum.name: Vehicle Piloting
datum.field: Truck driver, construction worker, some soldiers
The ability to drive land-based vehicles other than automobiles or motorcycles. This would apply to things like heavy trucks, buses, tanks, construction equipment, forklifts, and other things.

datum.name: Veterinary Medicine
datum.field: The medicine skill applied to animals. See Medicine skill for more detail.

datum.name: Weaponry
datum.field: Knowledge of weapons design, suitability of weapons, and how to make weapons. In an archaic setting, this would include how to make simple weapons. In a modern setting, one could design weapons, but might not be able to build them (that might require such skills as mechanical or electrical engineering, machining, etc.)

datum.name: Whore
datum.field: This is effectively a specialization of the skill

datum.name: Work
datum.field: Special skill. This can be thought of as a resume or work experience. It implies that you have work experience and higher levels mean you are a desirable employee. Talk to your GM about what this skill does for you.

datum.name: Writing
datum.field: The ability to write convincing literary works. This could be poetry or prose, fiction or nonfiction. (This is NOT the skill of being literate. This is the skill of being a good writer).

datum.name: Zero-G
datum.field: Imparts the ability to control one's body movements effectively in low-G or zero-G environments such as in space, freefall, or underwater.

datum.name: Zoology
datum.field: The academic study of animals; including their biology and their behavior, etc.

datum.name: Arm Blades
datum.field: One or more metal blades is inserted into the forearm. It can extend forward or swing out from the back of the arm. The blades are used with the small sword skill and can deal 16+2S

datum.name: Arm Guards
datum.field: Special armor plating is inserted into the back of the forearm. This makes the forearm and effective tool for parrying melee attacks. Armor is 5/9/5

datum.name: Climbing Hands
datum.field: A special set of hands designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing Feet, bonus is a total of +6

datum.name: Concealed Gun
datum.field: A semiautomatic gun, in any normal pistol caliber, can be concealed in the forearm

datum.name: Extendable Arms
datum.field: The ability to extend your arms up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the arms fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.

datum.name: Finger Sprayer
datum.field: This device, when implanted into a hand, can be used to spray chemicals a short distance away. It can't store very much liquid, however.

datum.name: Grip Lock
datum.field: This allows the user to lock his grip on an object. When locked, it requires 5 greater than the user's STR to un-break the grip. It also gives +5 to STR checks for holding onto an object.

datum.name: Heated Hand
datum.field: This modification gives your hands -1 DEX, but allows you to heat your palms to a significant temperatures. This can be used to deal 14U damage in an attack, or for cooking food, etc.

datum.name: Hollow Arm
datum.field: Gives 2 slots in either arm. 1 in upper arm, one in lower arm.

datum.name: Palm Sheild
datum.field: An armored palm can be used as a shield to block attacks, etc. The palm has 6/8/4 armor after this modification.

datum.name: Subdermal Watch
datum.field: A luminescent watch is implanted beneath the skin somewhere on the body. It is usually in the wrist area. It tells perfect time, and you can't ever loose it!

datum.name: Tool Hands
datum.field: Small tools, similar to a swiss army knife, are implanted into the hands. They aren't strong enough for tough jobs, but are very handy for light work. Includes a small knife, scissors, file, saw, various screwdrivers, bottle/can opener, etc.

datum.name: Typing Hands
datum.field: Robotic fingers can split apart into six individual micro-fingers. This allows one to type on a keyboard much faster than with normal hands. When in typing mode, hand has a STR of 2.

datum.name: Abnormal Articulation
datum.field: A modification to your joints. It enables a given joint to move in a manner in which it normally couldn't. (so, you could bend your knee backwards, for example)

datum.name: Alternate Digestive Orifice
datum.field: Adds another orificice to the body (or adapts an existing one), enabling you to eat from it. Thus, it's possible to eat through your ear, etc.

datum.name: Climate Adaptability
datum.field: Improves your ability to survive and perform in odd enviornments, such as deserts, snow, high altitude, etc.

datum.name: Cosmetic Addition
datum.field: A minor cosmetic modification to the body, such as skin ridges, changing the shape of part of the body, etc.

datum.name: Dermal Backlight
datum.field: Makes your skin glow. You can turn it on and off at will

datum.name: Detachable Joint
datum.field: Enables a certain joint in the body (knee, wrist, elbow, etc.) to be detached and re-connected at will. This enables you to switch limbs or attachments on your body.

datum.name: Dynochromatic Skin
datum.field: Change the color of your skin. It can be changed to any color, or patterns, etc. Changing takes a few seconds.

datum.name: Easy Maintenance
datum.field: Makes healing your body and working on your cybernetics unusually easy. Downtime is reduced by half.

datum.name: Electrically Shielded Body
datum.field: Protects the body from electrical damage. Take only 50damage from electrical attacks unless they originate from inside the body.

datum.name: False Bleeding
datum.field: Make yourself bleed at will, for no reason, and without harm. You can stop the false bleeding at will.

datum.name: Fireproof Skin
datum.field: Prevents the skin from burning in normal situations. You take half damage from short-term contact with fire.

datum.name: Gills
datum.field: Enables you to create water naturally. Usually installed on the neck, but could be anywhere. The Gills are a sensitive organ.

datum.name: Hair Control
datum.field: Enables you to control the look of your hair at will. This can do anything that normal hair styling can do, and affects the entire body

datum.name: Hard Skin
datum.field: Hardens the skin all over your body. 3/0/0

datum.name: Increased STR for muscles
datum.field: Upgrade the STR of your muscles. Can be purchased as many times as you want. Each purchase is +1 STR

datum.name: Increased Twitch Fibers
datum.field: Increases the amount of fast-twitch muscle fiber in your body. Gain +3 STR for fast applications, but suffer a -1 BLD. You also suffer and -3 STR for anything that takes longer than a second. -2 Enc

datum.name: Increased perception (sense skin)
datum.field: Improves the sensitivity of your skin. You can accuratley determine the shape, size, texture, and temperature of objects touching you.

datum.name: Increased speed of Wings
datum.field: Adds speed to your wings. Each purchase is +20 MPH

datum.name: Melanin Control
datum.field: Change the color of your skin. It works fairly slowly, and can only be used to match normal human colorskin. It can be white, black, yellow. You can simulate tans, etc, but cannot do unnatural colors.

datum.name: Muscle replacement
datum.field: Replace your muscles with superior lab-grown ones. +1 STR and +1 BLD

datum.name: Myomer muscle fibers
datum.field: Muscle enhancement which improves motor control. Each purchase adds +1 DEX. Can be purchased more than once, but each consecutive purchase is twice the cost of the previous one.

datum.name: Nervous System replacement
datum.field: Replaces your nervous system (except the brain) with an electronic network.

datum.name: Pain Editior
datum.field: Enables you to shut off or dimininsh pain at your will

datum.name: Radiation Immunity
datum.field: Protects the body from radiation from outside sources. Will not protect you from ingesting radioactive materials, etc.

datum.name: Reenforced Skeleton
datum.field: Toughens your skeleton and improves how smoothly it moves, improving your BLD by 1 point

datum.name: Replaced Skeleton (Flexible)
datum.field: A replacement for your normal skeleton. The bones are make of many individual joints, and can be bent at will. This enables you to perform amazing feats of contortion. +1 DEX -1 STR

datum.name: Replaced Skeleton (Rigid)
datum.field: A replacement for your normal skeleton. It has the ability to be locked rigid, giving you a +3 to STR contests, and an additional +1 BLD

datum.name: Self Sealing Blood Vessels
datum.field: Your blood vessels will seal themselves very effectivley if cut or otherwise damaged. You don't loose extra HP after going below 0, and don't bleed appreciably.

datum.name: Slick Skin
datum.field: Makes your skin unusually slick and slightly slimy. It makes it very difficult for something to grab you (-3), and slashing weapons have a tendency to slide off. (0/3/0)

datum.name: Spongy Skin
datum.field: Makes your skin tougher and thicker than normal. It cushions impact. (0/0/3)

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (heavy)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 6/6/5. This is highly visible

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (light)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 2/2/2. This is almost invisible

datum.name: Subdermal Armor (med)
datum.field: Armored mesh is implanted below the skin. It is located everywhere execpt the face, groin, hands, and feet. Armor is 4/4/4 this is visible if someone looks for it.,

datum.name: Suspended organs
datum.field: A special network of neuro-activated wire actuators suspends your vital organs. If something penetrates your body, they pull your organs out of the way. Take 50piercing damage. Only works if you are not wearing any armor.

datum.name: Tail (balancing)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It is thick and sturdy. It improves your balance, giving +3 to balance-related DEX checks.

datum.name: Tail (cosmetic)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It has sensation, but has no real use other than cosmetics.

datum.name: Tail (prehensile)
datum.field: A tail is added to the body. It has DEX equal to your normal value. It can be used to hold onto things, etc. Also gives balance dex bonus

datum.name: Toxic Skin
datum.field: Enables you to secrete a weak poison from the skin. It is foul tasting, and deals 14-1 damage if ingested. Anything biting you must make a WILL check at -8 or immiedtly let go. (except robots, undead)

datum.name: Wing blades
datum.field: Addes blades to your wings that can be used as weapons. Use with unarmed combat. 36 damage.

datum.name: Wings
datum.field: Adds a set of wings to the body. They can be used to fly up to 20 MPH. Wings can retract inside the body for 2 slots and 6 more CP.

datum.name: Advanced Audio
datum.field: Hear a whisper from 100 meters away

datum.name: Advanced Olfactory System
datum.field: Increases senses of taste and smell by 4 times.

datum.name: Advanced Tasting
datum.field: Increase sense of taste by 100 times

datum.name: Alternate breathing passage
datum.field: Additional hole to breath from (can be anywhere on body)

datum.name: Anti-Dazzle
datum.field: Immune to flash and laser blinding

datum.name: Automatic Reticle
datum.field: Gives + 1 to strike with ranged weapons

datum.name: Chemical Identification
datum.field: Detect Hormonal changes, sweat, lie detect (as if at level 4), etc...

datum.name: Cold Breath
datum.field: must have 1 slot for fuel. 14 D, half damage against hard armor

datum.name: Cosmetic Ear change
datum.field: Change ears to look like anything you want

datum.name: Cosmetic Eye Change
datum.field: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. Permanent change.

datum.name: Cyber hair
datum.field: Metallic hair, effect is cosmetic only

datum.name: Detachable Jaw
datum.field: Character can unhinge the jaw, allowing him or her to swallow objects up to 3 times normal size

datum.name: Disguise Face (Facial Features)
datum.field: Character can completely change his or her facial features, not including facial hair. This process takes a minute of concentration.

datum.name: Droud
datum.field: A device for stimulating the pleasure or pain centers of the brain directly.

datum.name: Dynamic Eye Changing
datum.field: Change the look of any/all portions of the eye. This can be color of the iris, pupil, or any other portion of the eye. This can also include glowing eyes. The look of the eyes can be changed at will, takes 15 seconds.

datum.name: Eye Laser
datum.field: 16+1S. Can be used once per round.

datum.name: Eye Lights
datum.field: The eyes can act like flashlights, emiting a beam of light up to 100' away

datum.name: Eye Projector
datum.field: The eyes can project a holographic image of anything the character wishes. The image is unmistakable for a hologram, and will fool only the most stupid into believing what they are seeing. Has no sound.

datum.name: Eye flash
datum.field: The eyes can emit a bright flash, momentarily stunning those without an anti-dazzle system. Stunned victives are at -3 to all actions for 14 turns

datum.name: Facial Hair Control
datum.field: Character can completely change his or her facial head hair. This includes style, sparseness, color, and placement

datum.name: False teeth
datum.field: Teeth are not natural, and they feel no pain

datum.name: Fangs
datum.field: Cosmetic. But if character has the Strengthened Bite implant, then fangs add +3 damage and changes damage to P.

datum.name: Heat Sensor
datum.field: 20ft range. Detect exact temperature of surroundings.

datum.name: Maxwell Board
datum.field: Regenerates 14+1 HP per round. 1 Slot for power source

datum.name: Memory Board
datum.field: Acts as a file system for remembering things. It can store up to twenty-five different memories. They can be accessed at will, and the information contained within will never be forgotten.

datum.name: Microscopic Vision
datum.field: Increase magnification by up to 200 times but for only objects very close to character

datum.name: Movement Board
datum.field: +1 DEX in applications where speed isn't an issue (Delicate tasks, etc.). If you have a Flexible Skeleton, add +1 DEX all the time and an additional +1 DEX for slow tasks.

datum.name: Multispeech
datum.field: Can speak multiple things at once

datum.name: Noise Filter
datum.field: Immune to loud noises, and filters out background noise to hear someone in a noisy area

datum.name: Nose gun
datum.field: 1 Shell in a nostril. Fired from trigger in mouth. Can be any automatic pistol caliber. Cost adds to the cost of the gun you want to use; min STR has -2 for this use.

datum.name: Octopus Board
datum.field: Gives + 4 Brain slots. Only one can be used

datum.name: Output Jack
datum.field: Allows for electronic output from brain to interface with electronics, computers, etc.

datum.name: Prehensile Tongue
datum.field: Cosmetic only. Has a 3 Strength, and a Dexterity of the user.

datum.name: Psionic Board
datum.field: Allows the use of a single psionic power (must be purchased normally). Also opens character up to attacks from this type of psionic attack (assuming it's a mental attack)

datum.name: Remote Eye
datum.field: Remove eye from socket, wire connects to face

datum.name: Slotted Robotic Brain (SRB)
datum.field: A.I. reconstruction of the human brain. Work identically to a human brain. Contains 8 brain slots which may be utilized for special brain upgrades. Can be located anywhere in the body. Frees up 2 slots in head. The SRB takes up one slot, can be located anywhere.

datum.name: Spitting Glands
datum.field: Spit a poison up to 20'. 5 doses

datum.name: Suicide system
datum.field: At will, the character can kill himself, just by desiring to die

datum.name: Ultrasonic Pickup
datum.field: Alows hearing of very high frequency sound, like an animal.

datum.name: V-System Board
datum.field: Can turn on and off at will. When on, it will provide +2 WIS, +2 INT, and +1 action for 14-1 turns. Then, it has the opposite effect for two turns, before it can be activated again.

datum.name: Ventriliquist System
datum.field: Character can speak without opening the mouth.

datum.name: Vision System
datum.field: The eyes are replaced by mechanical versions that perform slightly better than their human counterparts. 4x normal vision

datum.name: Vocal Blast
datum.field: Deal 24C damage to a target up to 100' away

datum.name: Vocal Screech
datum.field: Stun all listeners of the screech for 14 turns. All those stunned lose an action for the duration.

datum.name: Vocal System
datum.field: Increase vocal range by 4 times. Gives a +4 to the singing skill.

datum.name: Voice Modulator
datum.field: Can change characters voice to any recorded voice

datum.name: Volume Control
datum.field: Increase or decrease volume by up to 10 times.

datum.name: Wideband Camera
datum.field: Sees IR and UV Light reflections

datum.name: Climbing Feet
datum.field: A special set of feet designed to improve your ability to climb. -1 DEX for normal tasks. +4 to climbing rolls. When combined with Climbing hands, bonus is a total of +6

datum.name: Durable Feet
datum.field: The feet are made unusually durable. They will not develop blisters nor get tired, even when doing heavy work. Stubbing a toe or having your feet stepped on will no longer be as painful and is much less likely to cause injury.

datum.name: Extendable Legs
datum.field: The ability to extend your legs up to twice their normal length. You have -3 STR with the legs fully extended. They can be extended and contracted at wll.

datum.name: Foot Blades
datum.field: Retractible metal blades are implanted into the foot. They give +1 damage to kicks and deal S damage.

datum.name: Foot Sheild
datum.field: The sole of the foot is toughened with implants. This eliminates the need to wear shoes. You can walk on any normal terrain without hurting your feet. They can also be used to block attacks (if you are sufficiently skilled). The sole has 4/5/3 armor.

datum.name: Foot Thrusters
datum.field: Small rocket engines implanted into the foot allow you to jump 50further than normal. They can also be used to accelerate the movement of the foot during a kick, adding +5 raw damage. Six uses before recharging.

datum.name: Heel Spike
datum.field: A metal spike is implanted into the heel. It makes it easier to run, walk, etc. on slippery surfaces. It also deals extra damage with kicks or stomps. (+1, P)

datum.name: Hollow leg
datum.field: Gives 3 slots in either leg. (two in thigh and one in calf)

datum.name: Jumping ability
datum.field: Can leap 10+3*X feet vertically or horizontally.

datum.name: Knee Spike
datum.field: A metal spike is implanted into the knee. It can be used to deal 16+1P damage. It also protects the kneecap from injury.

datum.name: Speed increase
datum.field: Gives 5 additional MPH per purchase. Can be bought 4 times without needing space. Beyond that, every 4 purchases requires a slot.

datum.name: Advanced Digestive Sys
datum.field: An improved digestive system. It allows you to eat and digest things that would normally have little nutriutional value. This includes stringy vegitation, wood, paper, hard meat, leather, etc. Also extracts more nutrition out of normal foods.

datum.name: Armored Crotch
datum.field: Protective armor applied to the crotch area. It elimiates the groin as an effective target in combat. Armor is 5/5/5

datum.name: Breathing Filter
datum.field: Allows you to breathe effectivley in bad enviornments, such as smoke, steam, or chemical vapors. It wont create oxygen out of nowhere, but it will filter out mild and some moderate irritants and hazardous substances.

datum.name: Crotch Gun
datum.field: Any pistol-caliber can be used. The gun is semiautomatic and is hidden in the groin area. Cost adds to the cost of the gun you pick. STR requirement is normal.

datum.name: Dilating Throat
datum.field: The throat can expand to much larger than it's normal size. This allows one to swallow large objects without a problem.

datum.name: Durable Genitalia
datum.field: Makes the genitals less sensitive to pain, damage, and disease. Improves sexual stamina, and elimiates chafing!

datum.name: Hyper Kidneys
datum.field: Improved kidneys allow you to eat spolied or rotten food that would otherwise make you ill. They remove toxins from the blood very effectivley.

datum.name: Improved Breathing
datum.field: Improves your ability to breathe under duress. You don't have to gasp or breathe hard when doing strenuous activity. Gives a +3 to BLD checks for strenuous activity.

datum.name: Internal Cavity Trans Sys
datum.field: A complex modification that enables things to be moved throughout the body. It can be used to remove embedded objects (splinters, bullets, etc.) this can be used with an internal storage compartment. Example: swallow a key and have it appear in the compartment.

datum.name: Metabolic Controller
datum.field: Allows one to control one's metabolism. This can be used to maintain a certain weight and to govern sleep cycles, etc.

datum.name: Nutrient Storage
datum.field: A small implant stores hyper-concentrated vitamins an minerals from when your body has a surplus and saves them for later, when needed. This allows the body to be healthy when eating poor food for extended periods of time.

datum.name: Odor Masking
datum.field: Enables the user to elimiate his or her natural scent. It also effects burps and flatulence, etc.

datum.name: Oxygen Storage
datum.field: A small tank implanted in the body is used to store compressed 3 hours worth of oxygen. It can be used to breathe anywhere. If the tank is destroyed, when full, it explodes and deals 66+3 damage to the host.

datum.name: Prehensile Genitalia
datum.field: Adds significant dexterity to the genitals. This is used to enhance sexual pleasure.

datum.name: Redundant Vital System
datum.field: Duplciates the effect of a vital organ (pick one). If the original is damaged, this takes over, saving your life.

datum.name: Retractible Genitals
datum.field: Normally used for males only. The genitals can be pulled up into the body to protect them from harm. Can also be used for disguise purposes.

datum.name: Sealing Lungs
datum.field: A modification to the lungs that enables them to seal themselves if punctured. If your lungs are wounded, you suffer no special effects.

datum.name: Self Destruct Bomb
datum.field: Enables the user to self-destruct his body and cause serious damage in the process. Deals 5x 66+3 to a 20' radius. Kills the character.

datum.name: Sex Changer
datum.field: enables the user to change his sexual appearance. The changetakes less than a minuite, and can make a man look like a woman, or vice versa, even when totally naked. It does NOT actually change the user's sex, just the appearance.

datum.name: Silent Running
datum.field: Makes the body quiet. It cancels the sound of the heartbeat, breathing, etc.

datum.name: Storage Compartment
datum.field: A compartment is installed in the body. It can be accessed by opening a door on the body. It can store something a little bigger than a soda can.

datum.name: Thermal Masking
datum.field: Makes the body appear room temperature.

datum.name: Vomit Tank
datum.field: takes a slot. The tank can be filled with anything you can swallow. At a later time, you can spew the contents of the tank forth, out your mouth.

datum.name: Waste Eliminator
datum.field: An upgrade to the digestive tract finds a way to use ALL the substances you ingest. It all but eliminates the need to excrete waste.

datum.name: Weight Control
datum.field: Enables the recipient to control his or her weight. By thinking about it, the user can add or remove fat quite quickly. Up to one pound per minuite. When gaining weight, the user must ingest something for the weight to come from (e.g. food)

datum.name: Anti-armor (arrows only!)
datum.field: A special type of arrowhead designed to penetrate heavy armor. They are expensive and time-consuming to produce, and therefore generally rare for military use (at least by common soldiers). The forged and hardened point is square or triangular in profile, carefully ground into a very sharp point.

datum.name: Barbed
datum.field: Common for hunting small game (especially birds), and also used for war. This is a standard arrow (bullet point) with several metallic barbs embedded in the head. It is difficult to remove, causing additional damage when it is pulled out of the target.

datum.name: Broadhead (hunting)
datum.field: These are the most effective hunting arrows. They aren't great at penetrating heavy armor, but are excellent for causing additional damage to the target. This is particularly desirable for hunting, because it is likely to kill or incapacitate the target animal quickly, even if the vital organs are missed. A broadhead is a wide, diamond-shaped head that has two or more fins on it that are sharpened into bladeswhich cut a devastating wound in the target.

datum.name: Bullet Point
datum.field: The standard type of arrow point. The tip is pointed, but somewhat blunt, like a rifle bullet. They are used for hunting small game, and for target shooting. They are also common arrows for some military use since they are easily and cheaply produced.

datum.name: Bullet Point (blunt/target)
datum.field: A common military arrowhead. This is also the most common type of dart. The head is made of steel, and fashioned into a narrow conemuch like a pencil. These types of arrows are generally not used for hunting, but are very effective for wartime use.

datum.name: Explosive
datum.field: A rare arrow design, which features a hollow head packed with gunpowder or other light explosive. When it strikes the target, it makes a small explosion. This has excellent damage potential. Unfortunately, the large, fragile, head makes this type of arrow poor at penetrating armor.

datum.name: Fire Arrow
datum.field: 5AP, has fire effect, light before shooting.

datum.name: Fire Point
datum.field: An arrow that is coated with cloth soaked in pitch, tar, kerosene, or some similar flammable material. It is set alight before firing. These arrows are commonly used for sending signals, and for setting enemy structures on firehowever, they are also effective for setting enemy soldiers on fire.

datum.name: ALCAR Plate
datum.field: ALCAR plate is heavy armor developed for use in military and SWAT applications. It consists of a helmet, long-sleeved jacket and pants. The suit is made of heavy ballistic nylon which is covered with form-fitting ALuminum-CARbon plates which cover the vast majority of the body.

datum.name: Articulated Plate
datum.field: Articulated plate represents the finest acheivement of the blacksmith-armorer. It consists of a full suit of form-fitting and overlapping metal plates that cover the entire body from head to toe. The superior joints in articulated plate provide much better mobility than standard full plate. Articulated plate must be made specifically for a given wearer.

datum.name: BSP Linked Plate Armor
datum.field: This armor was developed for strategic depolyment by special forces soldiers and elite personal security details. It offers superior protection to armors of similar weight. This armor consists of a Spectra sleeved vest and matching pants. The entire suit is covered with polymeric plates reenforced with boron nanotubes. The thickness and shape of the plates is optimized to provide good mobility and protection.

datum.name: Ballistics Cloth (Heavy)
datum.field: Heavy bulletproof vest with a trauma plate in the chest area.

datum.name: Ballistics Cloth (Light)
datum.field: A very light bulletproof vest. This is typically used by undercover police or anyone that needs unobtrusive protection.

datum.name: Ballistics Cloth (Standard)
datum.field: A typical Kevlar bulletproof vest. Very commonly issued to soldiers and police.

datum.name: Banded Mail
datum.field: A leather suit covered in overlapping and layerd metal plates that curve around the body.

datum.name: Beast Leather
datum.field: Leather armor made from special leather from wilderness beasts. Scarce.

datum.name: Biker's Leathers
datum.field: Leather suit worn by motorcycle racers. The suit is specially tailored to fit the rider while in the ridng position. This, size is considered to be zero when the rider is on a motorcycle.

datum.name: Boron-Ceramic Plate
datum.field: This high-tech armor is typically marketed to private security and mercenaries as it is generally too heavy for use by typical police or military forces. It consists of incredibly tough dual-phase plate armor over a spectra inner suit. This armor is exceptionally resistant to battle damage and is capable of absorbing a remarkable amount of damage before becoming unusuable.

datum.name: Brigandine
datum.field: Brigandine armor is made from a heavy cloth or supple leather tunic that is fitted with a regular pattern of rectangular iron plates. It covers the body from the neck to the thighs, and also covers the shoulder area.

datum.name: CLAF Suit
datum.field: CLAF armor is the trade name for Cross-Linked Aramid Fiber. This armor is a technologically superior bulletproof vest which covers the chest, torso, and groin area. CLAF armor is common amongst police in affluent precincts and is also issued to some frontline infantry troops.

datum.name: CLB-WAF Suit
datum.field: CLB-WAF, called Clubwaf by its wearers, is the most effective bulletproof vestdeveloped. It consists of a Spectra-boron nanocomposite thread that is woven into armored cloth. This armor delivers remarkable protection but is light enough to be used by beat cops and common soldiers.

datum.name: Carbon Fiber Plate
datum.field: This is the modern equivalent of plate mail armor. Unlike it's historical equivalent, this armor is made of lightweight composites. It also incorporates flexible joints which means that it is nearly universal in fitment. It consists of high saturation 3D carbon fiber matix plates impregnated with semimetallic resins. This armor is typically used by SWAT and Military units.

datum.name: Ceramic Plate
datum.field: Ceramic Plate armor was developed as an outgrowth of vehicle armor research. Ceramic Plate consists of large, scuplted plates that closely fit the body. The joints are unarmored. Though it is an uncommon choice for military or police use, it is very popular amonst freelance mercenaries and adventurers due to its excellent fire resistance.

datum.name: Chain Mail
datum.field: Chain mail consists of an armored vest (Hauberk) and pants. The armor is a very flexible fabric that is made of thousands of interlocking metal rings. Typically this is worn over padded armor as the rings are known for chafing against bare skin.

datum.name: Chain and Brigandine
datum.field: A chain mail suit covered with thick metal plates

datum.name: Cloth
datum.field: Heavy clothing designed especially for protectionlike a woodsman's coveralls, etc.

datum.name: Densematter Plate
datum.field: Heavy hard armor carrying collapsed abotex plates. Exceedingly rare.

datum.name: Double Mail
datum.field: Similar to chain mail, but a superior design with a higher denisty of rings.

datum.name: Elven Chain Mail
datum.field: A superior form of chain mail made from exceptionally small metal rings that are interlinked in three dimensions.

datum.name: Elysian Plate
datum.field: A fine suit of plate armor. It is made of exotic metals and has finely fitted joints to improve mobility.

datum.name: Fiberglass Plate
datum.field: Hard armor composed of fiberglass-epoxy plates over a kevlar interior

datum.name: Field Plate aka 3/4 plate
datum.field: A chain mail suit covered with thick, form-fitting heavy metal plates

datum.name: Fishback Ceramic
datum.field: A heavy synth coat covered with hundreds of small hexagonal CERMET plates

datum.name: Fishback Steel
datum.field: A heavy denim coat covered with hundreds of small hexagonal metal tiles

datum.name: Flak Armor
datum.field: A thick, bulky vest that is padded and contains iron plates that cover vital areas of the chest and groin. (Millitary style, WWII, etc.)

datum.name: Forged Plate
datum.field: Metallurgically improved plate armor. It is the same encumberance but provides better protection.

datum.name: Full Plate
datum.field: A full chain mail suit completely covered with form fitting heavy steel plates

datum.name: Furs
datum.field: cold weather clothing made from leather and animal furs

datum.name: G-Alloy Plate
datum.field: Highly advanced semimetallic armor oriented on the molecular level

datum.name: Gentleman's Vest
datum.field: A snazzy, gray, woolen, formal vest. It is somewhat bulky, but very debonair. Adds +1 to all Build-related skills. A magical item.

datum.name: HC Aramid Armor
datum.field: Heavy hard armor made from hard-cast semimetallic composite plates

datum.name: Half Plate
datum.field: A chain mail suit sparcely covered with thick, non-interlocking plates

datum.name: Hard Leather
datum.field: Similar to soft leather, except that the main pieces are made of hard tooled leather

datum.name: Heavy Jacket
datum.field: Any sort of unusually thick clothinglike a parka, leather jacket, heavy denim, etc.

datum.name: Heavy Plate
datum.field: A suit of fully enclosed metal plate armor. The plates are thicker than normal for superior protection.

datum.name: Jack/gravel coat
datum.field: A cloak made of heavy cloth secured with leather straps. The surface is covered with small stones and bits of metal bonded and sewn in place.

datum.name: Kevlar
datum.field: armored clothing made from pure kevlar with normal cloth over it. Designed to be inconspicuous. (used by diplomats, etc.)

datum.name: Knitted Steel
datum.field: Armor made from weaving steel wire into cloth

datum.name: Light Plate
datum.field: A partial plate suit. It consists of a breast plate, shoulder plates and greaves. The plates are cut to maximize movement.

datum.name: Linked Metal
datum.field: secondary armor for millitary applicationsa network of metal plates over a cloth vest

datum.name: Mylar
datum.field: Thin armor material that is nearly impossible to cut

datum.name: Nomex
datum.field: Tough clothing made from NOMEX fibersdesigned for fire protection. Worn by firefighters and emergency workers

datum.name: PACA Mesh suit
datum.field: Millitary armor made from tough armored fibers and composite plastics

datum.name: PLCALF Armor
datum.field: Same as the above, with additional polymeric plates in key areas. This is the heaviest armor used by ultramodern SWAT forces.

datum.name: Padded
datum.field: Heavy clothing lined with multiple layers of thick fur, padding, etc.

datum.name: Polymer Plate
datum.field: Light hard armor made from advanced polymeric plates over a kevlar suit

datum.name: R-Polymer Plate
datum.field: Polymeric hard armor containing steel inserts in all plates

datum.name: RIR Hazard Suit
datum.field: Rubber-impregnated polyester fabric filled with dogbone-shaped interlocking metal bars. Protects against chemicals too.

datum.name: Racer's Suit/Pilot's suit
datum.field: Full body jumpsuit made of fireproof materials. Designed to save the life of race car drivers, pilots, etc, in the event of a crash or fire.

datum.name: Reinforced Leather
datum.field: Very hard and stiff leather with inlaid metal reinforcements. The edges are ringed in metal.

datum.name: Ring Mail
datum.field: Large metal rings held together with leather straps

datum.name: Riot Armor
datum.field: Standard SWAT armor: Ballistics cloth with metal plates in key locations

datum.name: SEB Hard Armor
datum.field: Boron-composite plates over a spectra undersuit. Rare, generally used by special forces or elite units.

datum.name: SPECTRA
datum.field: Improved version of Kevar, very flexible yet stands up well to piercing and slashing

datum.name: SPECTRA Tactical Vest
datum.field: A heavy bulletproof vest made from the improved SPECTRA material with a steel chestplate

datum.name: Scale Mail
datum.field: Hard leather armor covered in overlapping metal scales

datum.name: Scale-over-Chain
datum.field: A chain mail suit with additional metal scales covering the chain material

datum.name: Silk
datum.field: Armored robes made from woven silk threads.

datum.name: Soft Leather
datum.field: Armored clothing made of pieces of thick, soft, leather sewn together

datum.name: Sorbothene
datum.field: A shock-damping suit made from a special rubber material

datum.name: Splint Mail
datum.field: Soft leather armor covered with paralell vertical bands of iron

datum.name: Steel Plate
datum.field: A modern version of full plate mail

datum.name: Stripped-Leather Mail
datum.field: Soft leather underlayment with multiple layers of hard leather straps held on by metallic buckles or rings. Creaks and makes noise when moving.

datum.name: Toad Armor
datum.field: Armor made of hundreds of toad-skins stitched together. This may be worn either inside or outside of armor as it is quite suppled and billowing. The armor provides protection against poisons and acids, as long as it is not punctured. Even though the armor is considered Hard it does not count as Hard for sizing and encumbrance purposes.

datum.name: Wyrmhide
datum.field: Special leather made from the hide of rare and dangerous monsters is used to make this superior type of armor.

datum.name: 2-Headed Axe
datum.field: The tool of a professional woodsman. The double-headed axe offers more weight and a backup cutting edge to help power through wood chopping chores. It also proved more effective on the battlefield than standard axes.

datum.name: Axe
datum.field: A typical axea tool for chopping and spitting wood. Many conscripted soldiers found their farm axes to be devastating in combat, often proving more effective than some swords.

datum.name: Berzerker Axe
datum.field: The strongest Nordic warriors often wielded huge, oversized, versions of the their typical war axe. Equipped with a double-edge head and a design that concentrates most of the blade weight towards the end of the weapon, the Berzerker axe is unequaled for damage potential. However, its massive size limits its use to the strongest heroes.

datum.name: Firemans Axe
datum.field: A tough, heavier, superior version of a normal axe designed for enabling rescue crews to quickly enter buildings. The fireman's axe has a spike on the back of the axe-head, enabling it to be used as a piercing weapon as well.

datum.name: Hatchet
datum.field: A small axe used for breaking up firewood and light-duty farmwork. Though not intended as a tool of war, hatchets served many a warrior as a backup weapon.

datum.name: Heavy Battle Axe
datum.field: Some of the strongest medieval knights depended on heavy battle axes to deliver maximum damage to their enemies, human or otherwise. The heavy battle axe is designed for the roughest combat conditions, equipped with a massive, broad, headand the weight to carry it through it's target.

datum.name: Light Battle Axe
datum.field: An adaptation of a wood-chopping tool to an implement of war. Light enough to be carried by most soldiers, yet capable of dealing high amounts of damage, light battle axes were favored weapons of many medieval armies.

datum.name: Lochaber Axe
datum.field: An oversized battle-axe subscribing to the idea that more weight equals more damageand rightly so. The Lochaber axe's massive blade deals huge damage, and the spiked backside can deal a very nasty piercing attack.

datum.name: Nordic War Axe
datum.field: Developed by the fiercest Norse barbarian tribes, this is a simple yet fearsome weapon. Forged from the superior steels of the northern countries, the huge swept blade would easily cleave armor and limbs alike, and the carved handle provided for a very controllable swing. Many Norse warriors named their war-axes such things as widowmaker or swordbreaker.

datum.name: Pickaxe
datum.field: A common tool for mining, digging, and general construction applications. The pickaxe is a heavy tool with a large, pointed, head. It is effective for breaking up rocks during mining, and breaking up armor in combat.

datum.name: Arab Mace
datum.field: A simple yet effective weapon, consisting of a wooden handle capped with a round iron or bronze head.

datum.name: Club
datum.field: A simple piece of wood or metal used to beat your opponent into submission. Think baseball.

datum.name: Cudgel
datum.field: A wooden club, traditionally made from a gnarled tree branch or root.

datum.name: Hammer
datum.field: A normal household hammer. You never know when you might need to use one as a backup weapon.

datum.name: Iron Cane
datum.field: +3 to parry, no penalty to parry heavy weapons

datum.name: Mace
datum.field: A common European weapon. The mace proved an effective weapon against opponents wearing chain mail or other soft armor. It is basically a club with a metal facing, often studded.

datum.name: Maul
datum.field: A tool for splitting logs, often adapted for combat purposes to split skulls. The maul is a wedge-shaped iron head mounted to a long handle.

datum.name: Sledge Hammer
datum.field: A large hammer, typically used for construction workand sometimes conscripted as a weapon. A sledgehammer has an iron head weighing several pounds mounted atop a long wooden handle.

datum.name: Slungshot
datum.field: A very easy-to-make weapon consisting of a cord with a weight on the end. A slungshot is used much like a yo-yo. It is not a chained weapon because of it's use: straight-line shots. The range of the weapon can be up to 10 feet. Specialists may use a variant called a loaded sleeve which is a modification of long robe-sleeves to use the weapon. As an Exotic weapon, the slungshot may be used twice in a single action.

datum.name: Tonfa or Truncheon
datum.field: A common sidearm of police and security personnel throughout the ages. It consists of a metal or wooden bar, about 18 long, equipped with a handle mounted at 90 degrees to the bar, one third of the way down. It is quick to swing, and can deal crushing blows. As well, it is effective at blocking enemy attacks.

datum.name: Boxing Irons of the Troll
datum.field: Heavy metal brass knuckles, shaped like a D; made by Rock Trolls. Can be used as Blunt or Body (punch). Can cast any of the following spells, but only one of the spells per day

datum.name: Brass Knuckles
datum.field: A piece of metal designed to fit inside a closed fist. It usually has spikes that protrude between the fingers, or rings that surround the fingersallowing one to deal more damage with punches.

datum.name: Cestus
datum.field: Similar to brass knuckles. This is a leather or fabric strap covered with metal studs that is wrapped around the fighter's hands and wrists.

datum.name: Gloves of Anointing and Retribution
datum.field: These gloves were owned by Julius Creese of the Church of St. Simon. Similar gloves have been used by important members of the church in times past, though their mothod of manufacture has been lost. A pair of whilte cloth gloves. The gloves are heavily starched and have a bright white color despite their age and lack of care. EAch glove has a large cuff that surrounds the wrist ofthe wearer. The left glove has black text reading Speak With The Deadsuperimposed over a cross imprinted onto the back of the hand. The right glove has text reading Saint Simon is in Heaven Now. These gloves have the following properties, which only work if both glvoes are worn

datum.name: Sap Glove
datum.field: These are leather gloves which have lead or steel shot sewn into the back of the fingers and hand. This protects the wearer's hands in a fight, and the extra weight deals extra damage. They are commonly used by bouncers, security personnel, and police forces.

datum.name: Studded or Spiked boots
datum.field: Fairly self-explanatory. These are heavy-duty boots with metal studs or spikes embedded in the toe areaperfect for delivering a thorough ass kicking.

datum.name: Ball and Chain
datum.field: An iron ball, often spiked, attached by a length of chain to a handle.

datum.name: Chain (weapon)
datum.field: A fairly long chain equipped with weights on either endvery effective for striking an opponent, and then entangling him.

datum.name: Chain - Normal
datum.field: A length of iron chain suitable for striking an opponent with.

datum.name: Chain with spikes-blades
datum.field: A length of chain that is periodically set with spikes or blades. A fairly unusual weapon, but one that is capable of causing serious damage in skilled hands.

datum.name: Flail
datum.field: Originally a grain-threshing tool. A flail consists of a stout handle capped with a hinged (or shortly chained) iron head, often studded.

datum.name: Nunchaku
datum.field: A common weapon of martial artists. Usually carried in pairs, nunchaku consist of two wooden or iron bars linked with a short chain. Though compact, they can deal devastating crushing blows.

datum.name: War Flail
datum.field: A variant of the flail designed for harsh combat. The war flail has a thick handle, and is equipped with three or more spiked iron balls on chains. It is a heavy and unwieldy weapon, but is very powerful.

datum.name: Atalatl
datum.field: The Atalatl is a device that is used to throw spears with greater power than a typical throw. It is used with short spears.

datum.name: Cicada Wing Blade
datum.field: The Cicada Wing Blade is a Chinese weapon that is held like a staff. It has a central handle, two large blades at either end, and two smaller blades that protrude from the blade-handle junctions. +1 to parry. Counts as double weapon

datum.name: Martel de Fer
datum.field: Literally Hammer of Iron, this is the largest of the hammer type weapons. It's fifty-pound iron head requires a true brute to swing, but woe to those who would be in its path.

datum.name: No-Dachi
datum.field: The largest of the Japanese swords. No-Dachi have blades that exceed 40 in length. The entire sword is considerably longer. They are strongly curved, and were worn slung across the back. Though they require significant space to swing, there is no more powerful sword in the world. A warrior with such a weapon would have no problem cleaving a man in half.

datum.name: Sai (pair)
datum.field: A farming implement that is fairly effective for combat use; typically used in pairs. Sai are slender metal rods with large handguards. They can deal strong blows in combat, and are very effective for deflecting and intercepting enemy attacks.

datum.name: Shortel
datum.field: An ingenious sword with a C-shaped curved blade. It is very effective at reaching behind an enemy's shield. A skilled fighter with this weapon will succeed in striking his target very frequently.

datum.name: Yoroidoshi Tanto
datum.field: A variant of the standard Tanto. This knife has a triangular profile and very thick, narrow blade. It is designed to pierce heavy armor, but is also a great slashing weapon. It takes an unusually skilled smith to forge this kind of Tanto, thus it is a rare and expensive knife.

datum.name: Yumi
datum.field: The Japanese equivalent of the Long bow. It is of composite design and is very large. The Yumi is unusual because the grip is located two-thirds of the way down the bow, rather than in the center, and it is fired with the bow leaning forward. This means that it requires a very high ceiling to fire a Yumi indoors. The design of this bow makes it extremely powerfuleasily capable of defeating heavily armored opponents. Unfortunatley, it is very large and therefore it can be difficult to transport.

datum.name: Zaghnal
datum.field: An Indian weapon, somewhat of a cross between a hammer, axe, and a pick. It appears much like a normal axe, but is equipped with a slender triangular-shaped head that offers it great flexibility as a weapon.

datum.name: Cleaver
datum.field: A butcher's cleaver, or combat variation thereof. It is a large, heavy, blade with a razor sharp edge. It has a short reach, but is devastatingly effective for chopping-type attacks. It is useless for stabbing.

datum.name: Dagger
datum.field: A combat knife, typically with a slender blade and a hand guard. A standard backup weapon for most soldiers.

datum.name: Katar
datum.field: Also called a Quatar or punch dagger. It consists of a handle mounted perpendicular to the blade, often in a Tshape. The handle is gripped in a closed fist, with a triangular blade extending forward. It is used in a punching motion.

datum.name: Kukri
datum.field: A Southeast Asian knife, as carried by the Gurkha regiments of India. This is a large weapon, nearly the size of a machete. The blade has a strong downward angle. It is nearly useless for stabbing, but is a very effective weapon and chopping tool. A well made kukri is just as effective as a small axe for chopping.

datum.name: Long Knife
datum.field: A special variety of fighting knife. The slender blade is longer than 8, and sharpened along both edges. This is among the largest weapons in this categoryand is effective for both stabbing and slashing.

datum.name: Serrated knife
datum.field: A knife with a scalloped or otherwise serrated edge. The serrations are very effective for damaging flesh, but reduce the knife's effectiveness at penetrating hard materials.

datum.name: Small Knife
datum.field: This would be a typical pocketknife, Swiss army knife, or any knife with a short blade. Not very effective as a weapon, but easy to concealand a decent backup.

datum.name: Stiletto
datum.field: Not so much a knife, but a slender metal spike with a handle. It cannot cut things, but is an excellent stabbing weapon, easily penetrating many types of armor. It does not deal much damage, so it is frequently used with poisons, or with called shots to vital organs.

datum.name: Tanto
datum.field: A Japanese knife forged in the traditional style. The blade is formed from multiple layers of different steels. Tanto are unusually well balanced, and are exceptionally effective slashing weapons. It has a very small hand guard.

datum.name: Bastard Sword
datum.field: This is the typical sword of the medieval knight. It is designed to be wielded with one or two hands, and can be used my most people.

datum.name: Broadsword
datum.field: Another common European sword. This weapon has a fairly short, wide, blade.

datum.name: Claymore
datum.field: A famous weapon of Scottish origin. This blade requires a very strong person to wieldeven two handed, but deals impressive damage to match. Claymores generally have a blade 5..6 feet long. The long reach of the claymore makes it effective for engaging multiple targets at once.

datum.name: Espandon
datum.field: A slender Spanish sword, rather like a large saber. Many of the world's greatest swordsmen relied upon this weapon to quell their foes.

datum.name: Flamberge
datum.field: A fearsome sword with scalloped, flame-like, blade edges. Sure to inspire terror in your enemies, before you cut them down where they stand.

datum.name: Grand Saber
datum.field: A weapon with exceptional deadliness and grace. The five-foot blade requires a very strong warrior to wield, but reciprocates with exceptional damage potential.

datum.name: Grand Sword
datum.field: The largest traditional sword. The grand sword appears much like a great sword, only larger. It is sufficiently heavy that only a mighty warrior might wield it, but is nearly indestructibleand is only matched by the No-Dachi in combat effectiveness.

datum.name: Great Sword
datum.field: A huge version of the typical medieval sword. This is a massive weapon, with a blade several feet long, and a thickness and width to match. Few foes are a match for a warrior who can wield this massive weapon.

datum.name: Katana
datum.field: The typical weapon of the Samurai warrior. The Katana is a long sword worn alongside a Wakizashi. The blade is generally around 24..30 inches in length, and is shaped to be a natural extension of the warrior's arm. Like the Wakizashi, the superior edge of this weapon makes it fearsome in combat. A true Katana wielded by a skilled warrior can cut through a steel pipe or a large wooden post.

datum.name: Long Sword
datum.field: A favored weapon of medieval heroes. The long sword is a slender weapon with deadly reach.

datum.name: Massive Sword
datum.field: Not so much a sword as a sword-shaped club. A massive piece of steel weighing in excess of forty pounds, few foes can withstand a blow from this weapon.

datum.name: Ram Dao
datum.field: Target must win STR contest to block or parry

datum.name: Tachi
datum.field: A more ancient Japanese sword. The Tachi is longer than a Katana, with a blade of around 34 or more inches long. Worn much like a European sword, this weapon offers exceptional power to a warrior who can wield it. It's is nearly impossible to use indoors due to it's length.

datum.name: Tai Chi sword
datum.field: The Tai Chi sword is an Asian weapon whose goal is grace and accuracy rather than raw mass and power. The weapon has a narrow, double-edged blade and is equipped with a strung counterweight on the pommel

datum.name: Axe
datum.field: A steel rod with a plasma blade at one end; damage listed for either end.

datum.name: Knife
datum.field: Your average knife. This would be a knife with a fairly large blade. Most sheath knives, kitchen knives, or hunting knives would fall into this category.

datum.name: Short Sword
datum.field: A standard European-style cut and thrustsword. It was the mainstay weapon of the footsoldiers of many past armiesa durable weapon that can be counted on in combat.

datum.name: Awl Pike
