datum.field: This is one of the simplest yet most effective polearms. An awl pike is a long, slender, metal spike affixed to the end of a long wooden pole. It is a highly effective stabbing weapon.

datum.name: Beaked Axe
datum.field: A long wooden pole topped with an iron head. One side of the head features an axe blade; the other is equipped with a spike for piercing armor. Originally used as a tool for shipsthe axe head was used to chop stuck mooring lines; the spike could be used to snag ropes or wreckage.

datum.name: Bicento
datum.field: Where most polearms consist of a smallish blade with a long handle, the Bicento is a long blade with a long handle. The blade and handle would both measure somewhere around 4 feet in length.

datum.name: Glaive-Guisarme
datum.field: A lengthy handle topped with a hook-like metal blade. It can deliver fierce attacks, and can also be used to pull riders off their mounts.

datum.name: Halberd
datum.field: A simple, effective, weaponespecially for defensive positions. A halberd is basically a large knife blade mounted on a pole for extra reach.

datum.name: Katakamayari
datum.field: A vicious Japanese polearm equipped with a cross-like blade. Though not exceptionally damaging in and out of itself, it is unmatched when wielded by a powerful warrior.

datum.name: Lance
datum.field: A long, reinforced wooden pole equipped with an iron point and handguard. It is generally used while riding on a charging horse. The faster you move, the more damage you can deal.

datum.name: Long Spear
datum.field: A larger spear used for hunting large animals, or for war. Generally around eight feet long.

datum.name: Lucerne Hammer
datum.field: Similar to a Beaked Axe. The head on a Lucerne hammer has one spiked face, and one crushing face.

datum.name: Military Fork
datum.field: A variant on a simple pike. The military fork is a group of thin metal tines (spikes) mounted to a long handle. It is much more effective for parrying than a pike, since one can catch weapons between its tines. It is also effective for huntingit is excellent for spearing small animals or fish.

datum.name: Naginata
datum.field: A Japanese halberd. The Naginata blade is actually much longer than its cutting edge, with the bulk of its length embedded in the handle. The superior blade and this unique construction make it a very deadly and well-balanced weapon.

datum.name: Pike
datum.field: A very long sharp stick. Pikes are generally much longer than other polearmsoften twenty feet long. The point is generally made from iron, but simple pikes might just have carved points.

datum.name: Sabre Halberd
datum.field: Similar to a normal halberd, but equipped with a long, slender, blade.

datum.name: Short Spear
datum.field: This is cross-listed in the spears section. This would be a common hunting spear.

datum.name: Trident
datum.field: Originally a fisherman's tool, and a favored weapon of the gladiatorial area. A trident is a spear with three points, increasing the chances of striking a target.

datum.name: Voulge
datum.field: A very large blade on a very long pole, dealing very high damage. Think of it like a halberd on steroids.

datum.name: War Scythe
datum.field: A farming tool for cutting grain or brush. An unlikely weapon, but strangely effective.

datum.name: Yari
datum.field: A Japanese spear equipped with a forged and polished head. Though generally not very long, it has excellent damage potential. It can be thrown, but is designed to be used as a hand-held weapon, for stabbing and slashing. Since the blade is edged, it always deals S damage.

datum.name: Yoroidoshi Yari
datum.field: A different type of Japanese spear designed to penetrate armor. The point is narrow and rather small. It is triangular in profile (like a stiletto), forged from hard martensitic steel. It is capable of piercing the toughest armor.

datum.name: Great Maul
datum.field: A massive wooden hammer originally meant for driving posts into the earth. A warrior with enough strength to swing a great maul could easily drive his opponents six feet under.

datum.name: Hercules Club
datum.field: A giant club that requires exceptional strength to wield. The weapon is roughly five feet long, with half of that length being the handle. The striking surface is covered in spikes fashioned from stone or iron.

datum.name: Morning Star
datum.field: A fearsome weapon with a well-deserved reputation for combat effectiveness. This is a technologically superior mace, usually fashioned entirely from iron. The head is covered with strong spikes, enabling this weapon do deal significant damage.

datum.name: War Hammer
datum.field: A stout weapon used by the strongest of knights. A war hammer is an oversized sledgehammer, often sporting an iron-reinforced handle and spike-like striking faces. In the right hands, a warhammer is capable of smashing even the toughest armors.

datum.name: Chinese war sword
datum.field: An ingeniously designed weapona stout, backswept blade of considerable thickness counterbalanced with a tassel and weighted knot. When wielded by a strong warrior, a truly fearsome weapon.

datum.name: Cutlass
datum.field: Similar to a saber. A fairly heavy sword with a backswept blade that was the sidearm of many a high seas buccaneer.

datum.name: Falchion
datum.field: Somwhat like a scimitar but with a straight blade. The back of the blade is straight, but the cutting edge is curved forward. The blade is very thick and gets wider near the tipthis concentrates the weight forward of the balance points of most swords. In the right hands, a very effective tool.

datum.name: Gladius
datum.field: The fearsome weapon of the Roman Legions. The Gladius is a heavy blade with an unusually sharp edge. It is good for stabbing and slashing. The Gladius is unusually durable.

datum.name: Saber
datum.field: A light sword with a backswept blade. A favored weapon of cavalries.

datum.name: Scimitar
datum.field: A heavy sword with a strongly curved blade. The excellent damage potential of this weapon made it favored with many Arab armies.

datum.name: Small Sword
datum.field: The class fencingsword used in duels from the16th19thc. If the user has weapon specialization in Small Sword then the weapon can be used as a P (Piercing) weapon for 26 with 4 AP and a MSB of 12. If the weapon is used as exotic (with the accompanying Exotic skill), then the wielder gets a bonus die to his pool when using the weapon with Multitarget.

datum.name: Stone Bat
datum.field: A 14'18' flat stone (typically jade) paddle. Has a razor-sharp edge. Weighs about 4 pounds for a 14' version, and an addition pound per inch. For each additional pound/inch add +2 to the MSB.

datum.name: Wakizashi
datum.field: A Japanese short sword. It is usually carried in combination with a Katana (large sword), worn on the hip with the sharp side of the blade pointed upwards. The fantastic damage potential of this sword is due to the superior metallurgy of the bladeenabling it to achieve an exceptional level of sharpness.

datum.name: Bo Staff
datum.field: A large fighting staff, generally made from tough woods such as oak, mahogany, or ironwood. The Bo is roughly six feet in length and shaped to offer an exceptional grip and balance.

datum.name: Full metal staff
datum.field: A fighting staff forged entirely from iron or other metal. Weighing twenty pounds or more, it requires a good deal of strength to wield. However, it is practically indestructible and deals savage blows that are difficult to deflect.

datum.name: Heavy Staff
datum.field: A wooden staff reinforced with iron end caps and studded bands throughout its length. The extra weight of the iron allows for devastating blows, and protects the wood from damage when parrying.

datum.name: Jo Staff
datum.field: A true fighting staff. The Jo is roughly four feet long, and tapers from a thick center section to about 15mm in diameter at the ends. Though light and easy to swing, it can be an excellent weapon.

datum.name: Long Staff
datum.field: A long wooden staff, such as a woodsman's hiking stick. Generally as long as the wielder is tall, the long staff can be a useful tool or an effective weapon.

datum.name: Quarterstaff
datum.field: A large fighting staff similar to the Bo. While the quarterstaff lacks the Bo's quality craftsmanship, it makes up for that by sheer mass. A quarterstaff is generally one foot taller than its wielder, and 30 or more mm thick.

datum.name: Short Staff
datum.field: A walking stick, cane, or similar wooden pole.

datum.name: Chakram (small)
datum.field: A ring-shaped blade hurled at your target, much like a Frisbee. Chakrams are available in various sizes, ranging from six inches in diameter to over 16. They are generally worn in groups on a belt hook, or slung on the warrior's arms.

datum.name: Javelin
datum.field: A specially shaped spear designed to travel long distances. It is highly streamlined, and features a deadly point. Javelins are quite light, and easily carried. They were often used by foot soldiers before they came into melee combat range.

datum.name: Short Spear
datum.field: as a throwing weapon (normally in Spear cat.)

datum.name: Shuriken, Common
datum.field: The well known Ninja's star. Shuriken are small starlike bladed throwing weapons, having anywhere from three to twelve points on them. The most common have between three and six points. They are very easy to conceal, but don't deal much damage. They are best used with skilled aim or with poisons. High quality shurikens are razor sharp and have superior damage capability.

datum.name: Throwing Axe
datum.field: A small axe balanced for hurling at your opponent. Surprisingly easy to use, and capable of dealing good damage. The throwing axe can also be used in hand-to-hand combat.

datum.name: Throwing Knife
datum.field: A knife specially designed for throwing. Throwing knives are usually double-sided, and have no handle covering. The handle is simply an unsharpened portion of the blade. They are made from unhardened steel so that they do not bounce or shatter on impact. If bent, they can be easily straightened.

datum.name: Thrown Spike
datum.field: A pencil sized steel dart with a tassel of some sort attached to the blunt end to ensure it flies straight. Especially effective with poisons. It has far better penetration capability than a knife or shuriken.

datum.name: ALICE Rig
datum.field: Millitary vest used to hold weapons, ammo, grenades, rations, tools, etc. for quick access.

datum.name: Ammo Pouch, combo
datum.field: A sturdy leather or nylon pouch that fits on your belt. Holds approx. 50 pistol rounds, 25 rifle rounds, or 15 shotgun shells

datum.name: Ammo Pouch, mag
datum.field: A leather or nylon pouch that fits on your belt. It holds up to four pistol magazines or two assault rifle mags

datum.name: Anti-dazzle lens
datum.field: Add this to a set of goggles or glasses. It prevents flashes of light, etc, from stunning the wearer.

datum.name: Backpack
datum.field: A satchel with two straps designed to be worn on the back. A normal backpack can carry up to 40 lbs. Higher quality backpacks can hold up to 60 lbs. With a proper frame and waist strap, a backpack can carry up to 225 pounds, but has significant encumbrance (+1 Encumbrance for every 25 lbs above 75).

datum.name: Backpack - hard
datum.field: Hiker's backpack with a metal frame. Carries up to 100 pounds of gear. Very comfortable.

datum.name: Bag of Holding
datum.field: A normal looking bag with an extradimensional space on the inside that holds extra weight and volume.

datum.name: Belt
datum.field: A piece of flat leather or other sturdy material with a hasp designed to keep a pair of pants on.

datum.name: Belt Buckle
datum.field: A large, flat plate designed to clasp a belt together. Typically comes with a design.

datum.name: Belt of Leaves
datum.field: A belt made of brass, gold, and copper leaves; probably made by elves for trackers and hunters. Provides +1 to strike.

datum.name: Binoculars, mini
datum.field: A pair of binoculars that folds up for easy carrying. Magnifies 4 times.

datum.name: Binoculars, standard
datum.field: A normal pair of binoculars. Has a neck strap and a carrying case. Variable magnification from 5 to 10 times.

datum.name: Binoculars, super
datum.field: A pair of high grade binoculars. Has a built in range finder and superior glass lenses. Mag varies from 5 to 20 times.

datum.name: Boat, Portable
datum.field: A backpack containing an inflatable boat, inflating device, and a set of collapsible paddles. Holds up to 750 lbs of people and gear. Not safe for ocean use, but not a toy.

datum.name: Boat, inflatable
datum.field: A simple inflatable boat. Light duty. Will hold up to 500 lbs.

datum.name: Boat, portable Zodiac
datum.field: Very high quality portable/inflatable boat. Kit weighs 160 lbs, carried in two packs. Has boat (seats four adults+250 lbs of gear), inflator, repair kit, portable paddes, and a small gas engine. Boat is very durable and will withstand small-caliber gunshots.

datum.name: Bowl
datum.field: A dish for serving things which are prone to escape.

datum.name: Breathing Apparatus
datum.field: Similar to a SCUBA tank. Has a mask and tank that protects the wearer from gases, diseases, fumes, etc, even in enviornments that have no oxygen. Worn by firefighters, etc. Tank is good for 3 hours, can be refilled.

datum.name: Bug, micro
datum.field: Listening device the size of a button. Transmits what it hears to a common AM/FM radio. Range is 1000' max.

datum.name: Bug, phone tap
datum.field: Listening device attached to a telephone. Range is 1 mile.

datum.name: Bug, super
datum.field: Listening device. Button sized, has special encrypted transmssions. Range is 1 mile.

datum.name: Bull's Eye Lantern
datum.field: A lantern with an enclosure that is either mirrored or highly-polished metal on the interior with a single exit hole. A Bull's Eye lantern produces a long beam (about 100 feet long) for normal burn time (see the Lantern), but only in a directed fashion. Some forms of the Bull's Eye Lantern have multiple shutters. Some have fresnel lenses (although this can increase the cost of the lantern by a factor of 10 or a 100). The lense increases the distance of the lantern to 250 feet.

datum.name: Butcher's kit
datum.field: Used for dressing animals in the field. Contains meat bags, skinning knife, saw, and a compact game hoist.

datum.name: Camera, Digital
datum.field: Digital video camera. Not a true pro-grade camera, but can store hundreds of photos and you don't have film hassles.

datum.name: Camera, Video
datum.field: Video camera that records to tape or data discs. It is NOT broadcast quality, but is compact and easy to carry.

datum.name: Camera, Zoom Lens
datum.field: Zoom lens for a camera for long-distance shots

datum.name: Camera, professional
datum.field: A pro grade film camera. Includes some different lenses, filters, etc.

datum.name: Camera, spy
datum.field: Super-small camera that can be easily concealed. Can be used like a normal camera, or can be set like a booby trap.

datum.name: Cart, 2-wheeled
datum.field: A two-wheeled cart with attachments for a single pulling animal.

datum.name: Cart, 4-wheel
datum.field: A four-wheel cart for use with a single draft-animal.

datum.name: Cart, Ox
datum.field: A 2-wheeled cart for an Ox, has a much deeper bed and much taller sides.

datum.name: Chemlight, bright
datum.field: A chemical light stick. Bend it to activate. This is a special stick that only lasts 20-30 minuites at most. It is VERY bright, like a good flashlight. Excellent for signaling, etc.

datum.name: Chemlight, mini
datum.field: A small chemical light stick. It's about the size of a hair pin. Makes a great fishing lure

datum.name: Chemlight, stick
datum.field: A chemical light stick. Bend it to activiate. Works in any temperature, no batteries, etc. Gives off enough light to perform simple tasks in complete darkness. Lasts for 8-10 hours.

datum.name: Climbing Gear
datum.field: Climibing shoes, gear belt / harness, climbing axe, pitons, etc.

datum.name: Climbing Gear - Ice
datum.field: As above, but includes ice axe, crampons (spiked shoes), ice screws, etc.

datum.name: Coat, Raincoat
datum.field: Waterproof coat. Good for travelling, etc.

datum.name: Coat, Trenchcoat
datum.field: Keeps you warm, dry, and is great for concealing things. Can conceal a shotgun or rifle.

datum.name: Combat Belt
datum.field: Keeps your extra magazines, grenades, pistol, etc, close at hand and ready for use

datum.name: Computer, PDA
datum.field: A small calculator-sized mini computer. Used for storing notes, directions, can also save small files, etc.

datum.name: Computer, advanced
datum.field: High powered computer, cutting edge of the era

datum.name: Computer, basic
datum.field: A simple computer with monitor, etc.

datum.name: Computer, portable
datum.field: Portable version of a normal computer. Runs off of batteries or can be plugged in.

datum.name: Cordelian Belt of the Warrior
datum.field: This was made by a Cordelian weaponsmith as a gift of a high-ranking military comander whose daughter the smith was courting. The accompanying armor was long ago destroyed, but the belt has survived. A dark brown iron studded leather belt with an iron buckle; shaped like a weight-lifters belt. Archaic Weapons at plus one level. -1 to all Charisma and Intelligence based skills. Healing magic has half effect.

datum.name: Cowboy Boots
datum.field: Midcalf heavy leather boots with a short heel and typically pointed shoe. Designed to ease horse-riding with stirrups.

datum.name: Cowboy Hat
datum.field: A type of hat normally worn by workers who deal with cattle in the open desert or other arid climates.

datum.name: Cyber-medicine kit
datum.field: Supplies for performing first aid on cyborgs, etc. Contains many of the same things as a normal first aid kit, but also specialized drugs, and extra supplies.

datum.name: Diving - Extra tank
datum.field: Extra tank gives up to 2 hour dive time.

datum.name: Diving Kit
datum.field: SCUBA kit with tank, regulator, weight belt, BCD vest. Everything needed for 1 person. 1 hour maximum dive time.

datum.name: Duffel Bag
datum.field: A heavy, denim bag in the shape of a tube with a single, heavy strap. Can easily accomodate 75 lbs. Larger versions can go up to 250 lbs. For every 25 lbs. a duffel bag adds 1 encumbrance.

datum.name: Elephant
datum.field: A large, four-kneed animal weighing around 16000 lbs. Elephants are the biggest of the domesticated draft animals. Carts and wagons must be specially designed to be used with them.

datum.name: Elephant of War
datum.field: An Elephant of War can weigh up to 26000 lbs and be 16 or 17 feet tall. This is the only type of elephant that can be controlled in combat.

datum.name: Feather Mattress
datum.field: A nice feather mattress; bulky but only about 25 lbs.

datum.name: Fishing Kit, portable
datum.field: A small box containing a multi-piece rod reel, line, hooks, lures, and a small folding net.

datum.name: Flannel Shirt
datum.field: A heavy shirt made of flannel with (pearl) snap buttons, with a collar.

datum.name: Flares, aerial
datum.field: These flares look like shotgun shells. They are fired from a launcher and ignite high in the air, whereafter they drift slowly back down. Available in red, green, blue, yellow, white. Priced per set of 5.

datum.name: Flares, launcher
datum.field: Looks like pistol. Fires aerial signal flares

datum.name: Flares, signal
datum.field: A stick-type flare that burns with a bright red flame. (Road flare). For marking targets, warnings, etc. Good for starting fires too.

datum.name: Flashlight, Heavy duty
datum.field: Metal police flashlight. Can be used as a club. Very tough, waterproof, high brightness

datum.name: Flashlight, Spotlight
datum.field: Portable spotlight for hunting, search-and-rescue, etc. Runs for 4 hours, VERY powerful.

datum.name: Flashlight, small
datum.field: A handy flashlight that fits in your pocket.

datum.name: Flashlight, standard
datum.field: A normal flashlight. It takes two D-size batteries.

datum.name: Flint and Tender
datum.field: Flint, Striker, a small, sealed, wooden box, and tender (typically moss). Can be used to start a fire, although this can take 15 or 20 minutes or more.

datum.name: Folding Chair
datum.field: Comes in two forms depending upon the time period. Pre-modern folding charis are a triangle of leather suspended between three stout posts. A modern (or ultramodern) chair forms a full chair with armrests and a back.

datum.name: Forensics kit
datum.field: Magnifying glass, fingerprinting supplies, disposable camera, evidence bags, composite sketch kit, notebook, handbook

datum.name: GPS Rec. superior
datum.field: Global Positioning System tool. About the size of a calculator. Has advanced 2-D and 3-D mapping information, weather data, can store and re-display paths travelled, etc. Can display directions in urban areas.

datum.name: GPS Reciever
datum.field: Global Positioning System tool. About the size of a calculator, it tells you exactly where you are in the world. Has limited mapping functions too.

datum.name: Gas Mask
datum.field: rubber mask with filter prevents poisous gases, smoke, etc, from harming the wearer. Filter is good for 6 hours.

datum.name: Gas Mask filter
datum.field: extra filter for gas mask. Lasts for 6 hours.

datum.name: Generator, large
datum.field: A big generator that might be found on a construction site. Can run power tools, big floodlights, etc.

datum.name: Generator, small
datum.field: A backpack sized portable generator. Good for operating small electronic devices like TV, radio, etc.

datum.name: Glass Bottle
datum.field: Glass bottles vary in cost dependent upon size, cost, quality, and timeperiod. For the modern period, a glass bottle is typically about 5 dollars per liter (non-bulk). In medieval periods they would be about 50 dollars per liter. In for "ancient" time periods or very-out-of-the-way, they are about 500 dollars (or more) per liter.

datum.name: Gloves, Butcher's
datum.field: Heavy-duty gloves made from kevlar or metal that prevents your hand from being cut when handling sharp objects. Has 1/4/0 Armor for the hands.

datum.name: Gloves, Grip
datum.field: Specially treated gloves to improve your grip on objects. Gives +1 STR when in a strength contest, etc.

datum.name: Gloves, Mittens
datum.field: Gloves for cold weather. -3 Dex while wearing them

datum.name: Gloves, Work
datum.field: Leather gloves to protect the hands from minor cuts and abrasions while working

datum.name: Goggles - combat
datum.field: Full wraparound goggles that protect the eyes from dust, shrapnel, chemicals, and laser sighting devices

datum.name: Goggles - night vision
datum.field: Provides monochrome night vision by amplfiying ambient light

datum.name: Goggles - thermal
datum.field: Allows wearer to "see" heat. It has a limited ability to see heat through things. The thicker the cover, the less detail.

datum.name: Handcuffs
datum.field: Police quality handcuffs. Cannot be broken unless STR >19, Lock can be picked at -4 to roll.

datum.name: Handcuffs, super
datum.field: Extra-high security handcuffs. Requires STR > 26 to break them. Lock is -10 to pick.

datum.name: Handkerchief
datum.field: A small square piece of cloth.

datum.name: Hat, Adventurer's
datum.field: Keep the sun and the bugs off your head.

datum.name: Holster, Hip
datum.field: A simple holster that holds your gun at your hip. Can be modern appearance, or "old west" type.

datum.name: Holster, SWAT
datum.field: Holds a pistol or SMG on your leg. Can't be concealed, but offers +2 to quick draw the weapon.

datum.name: Holster, Shoulder
datum.field: Quality leather rig holds your pistol by your shoulder or armpit. Conceals under a jacket easily. Fit to the wearer

datum.name: Holster, concealed
datum.field: Used to conceal a gun inside your pants or by your bellybutton.

datum.name: Horse, Draft
datum.field: A horse that has been only been trained to draft; that is be hitched to pull a plow, wagon, cart, ferry, etc. These horses can weigh up to 1500 lbs. (making them about the size of the largest Warhorse). They can stand up to 16 hands at the withers.

datum.name: Horse, Riding
datum.field: A horse that has been trained to be ridden. Not combat ready.

datum.name: Horse, Shire
datum.field: A shire horse is the largest of the Draft horses. They can be 18 or 20 hands high and over a ton, and some specimens (although very rare) have come in at 24 hands and 3000+ lbs. These horses, even given their size, are unusually strong, and have unusual endurance. They are known for their kindness, but also for their great stupidity. They are unusable as Warhorses, although attempts (unsuccessful) have been made.

datum.name: Horse, Thoroughbred
datum.field: Also called a Postal Horse. These are the fastest horses money can buy; they have been bred for unusually long endurance, which means Thoroughbreds are not only the fastest but also the longest distance horses. It is not unusual for a Thoroughbred to be able to maintain speeds of 40+ mph for 6 or more hours.

datum.name: Jean's Jacket
datum.field: A heavy, denim jacket. Normally with heavy brass flat-tack buttons and pockets.

datum.name: Jeans
datum.field: A pair of pants made from heavy denim, normally triple-stitched for extra strength. Typically comes with front and back pockets and loops for a belt.

datum.name: Jerry Can
datum.field: A metal or plastic container for storing transporting gas, water, oil, etc. Very rugged. Has a 5 gallon capacity, and can be used with most chemicals.

datum.name: Lantern
datum.field: Gas or oil. A lantern is a bulkier but more efficient way to light an area as it typically comes with a glass enclosure and a flue to increase the temperature of burning. A lantern burns one ounce of oil per hour to light a 20 foot radius. Burning four times as much oil per hour double the equvalent lit area.

datum.name: Lock Picks, gun
datum.field: A nifty little tool that will open nearly all simple key locks in a second or two. Can be used by unskilled persons. Tool gives Lockpick: 2 regardless of level of user. Only works on simple locks (no good for cars, safes, combinations, etc.)

datum.name: Lock Picks, master
datum.field: A full lockpick set, about the size of a hardcover book. Contains many different types of picks and specialty tools. Use for car locks, padlocks, doors, etc. +3 to lockpick skill.

datum.name: Lock Picks, mini
datum.field: A small leather pouch containing a tension wrench and 3-4 commonly shaped picks. Good for simple locks.

datum.name: Lock Picks, set
datum.field: A pouch about the size of a glasses case. It contains a tension wrench, and an assortment of picks and other lock tools. This would be sufficient for most locks.

datum.name: Medical Kit
datum.field: A small tote bag with a good selection of first aid supplies. Gauze banadges, antiseptic, scissors, simple drugs, elastic bandage, etc.

datum.name: Medical Kit - First Aid
datum.field: A small waterproof box with basic first aid supplies (band aids, gauze bandages, ointment, aspirin, etc.)

datum.name: Medical Kit - Large
datum.field: A large duffel bag crammed with most of an emergency room. Enough to complete simple many surgical procedures. A full assortment of bandages, many drugs (painkillers, disease treatments, anesthetic, antibiotics, etc), surgical tools, splints, portable EKG machine, emergency fluids blood supply, sutures, etc.

datum.name: Mess Kit
datum.field: Frying pan x2, pan lid, cup, bowl, knife, fork, spoon, and salt/pepper shaker. It all nests together in a small pouch.

datum.name: Mobile Phone
datum.field: Portable telephone. Works off of cellular system. Works in all major cities and most suburbs.

datum.name: Mobile Phone, sat
datum.field: Portable telephone. Works off of satellites. Works anywhere on earth.

datum.name: Oil Lamp
datum.field: Come in various sizes (ounces of fluid). An oil lamp burns about one ounce of oil per hour to light a 10-foot-radius zone. Burning the oil four times as fast doubles the equivalent site radius. Oil lamps can be made of many materials such as stone, fired clay, glass, brass, bronze, or steel.

datum.name: Oliphant
datum.field: An Oliphant is a semimagical breed of Titanic War Elephant. They are typically about 40' feet tall and weigh around 55 tons. They are adorned with tusks, uptusks (like a warthog), sabre-fangs, and incisorial glancing-tusks (upward bending tusks like a walrus).

datum.name: Pine Tar Torch
datum.field: Lasts approximately 2 hours in a well-ventilated room. Gives off a prodigious amount of smoke, but smells pretty good.

datum.name: Pitch Torch
datum.field: Pitch torches are "better" than pine-tar torches because they produce a less perfidious odor. They also lasts about 6 hours.

datum.name: Pouch
datum.field: A small bag, usually with a drawstring. Can hold only a couple of pounds of items.

datum.name: Radio, Comm headset
datum.field: A radio headset that has hands-free operation. Works up to 2 miles away in clear areas. Each

datum.name: Radio, Walkie-Talkie
datum.field: A hand-held radio that lets you talk to other people with similar radios. Has a range up to 2 miles in clear areas. Each.

datum.name: Rations
datum.field: Millitary ration (MRE) or equivalent. A plastic bag containing a full meal. About as big as a "bag lunch"

datum.name: Rations - mini
datum.field: A small food bar. Highly nutritious (1 day's food in one bar!), but tastes awful. Same size as a candy bar.

datum.name: Repair Kit
datum.field: For repairing robotics, power armor, and mecha. Contains specialized tools (but not basics, which are also needed) Oil, wire, common replacement parts, special repair materials, etc.

datum.name: Ring of Daylight Globe
datum.field: A ring with the Daylight Globe spell cast on it. This normally has either fixed charges or charges-per-day.

datum.name: Ring of the Ram
datum.field: Crafted by Darin Tealpeck who wore it whenever he left his castle. A large man's ring mad eof a gold-bearing alloy. Roughly made, with a head of a ram on it. Tarnished.

datum.name: Rope, climbing
datum.field: Woven rope handles better and is safer for climbing than normal rope. Can hold up to 1000 lbs. 100 feet

datum.name: Rope, utility
datum.field: Basic twisted rope. Good for all sorts of uses! Can hold up to 500 lbs before it breaks. Price is for 100 feet

datum.name: Satan's Stopwatch
datum.field: Using a move equivalent action, turn on Satan's Stopwatch. For this turn and the next, gain an extra standard action. The Stopwatch is truly indestructible; when using the watch, the user's aura is modified to reflect Satan's power.

datum.name: Sharkskin Gloves
datum.field: Crafted approximately one hundred years ago by a seafaring people of unknown origin. A pair of gray leather gloves that cover all five fingers and end at the wrist. A set of woven silk laces on the back of the hand allow the gloves to be secured tightly to the hand. The leather is made from the preserved hide of a giant shark

datum.name: Shovel
datum.field: For digging holes. A regular shovel with a wooden handle

datum.name: Shovel, folding
datum.field: Portable army shovel. It folds up to take less space.

datum.name: Skillet
datum.field: A heavy, flat, iron pan. Skillets come in all sizes. Superior versions have very thick cast-iron bottoms.

datum.name: Sleeping Bag
datum.field: A flat, heavy bag designed to be slept in. Can be made of light leather, denim, or cotton with a stuffing (the best use arctic feathers). A sleeping bag can accommodate one person comfortably or two as a tight fit. Superior versions are no heavier or bulkier but can enable surviving cooler tempatures. A normal sleeping backpack is good down to freezing. Additional superiority can reduce the minimum tempurature in steps of 40 degrees.

datum.name: Snowshoes
datum.field: For walking on snow. Also useful for loose desert sand

datum.name: Socks
datum.field: Wool or cotten tube designed to be worn on the foot.

datum.name: Spidersilk Rope
datum.field: This is for 1 feet of rope. Weighs 12 ounce.

datum.name: Suit- Dry suit
datum.field: Used for diving in very cold water.

datum.name: Suit- Enviornmental
datum.field: Special rubber and plastic suit covers the entire body. Has a built-in gas mask. Prevents harm due to posion gas, smoke, dangerous chemicals, spills, fumes, toxins, diseases, etc.

datum.name: Suit- Fire
datum.field: NOMEX clothing and helmet. Has no armor value, but protects wearer from fire.

datum.name: Suit- Ghillie
datum.field: Sniper's camo suit. Must be purchased for a certain type of terrain (desert, woodland, urban, etc...) Gives +4 to camo skill.

datum.name: Suit- Space
datum.field: Space suit, similar to that worn by astrounauts. Has an emergency air supply built in.

datum.name: Suit- Wetsuit
datum.field: Used for diving. Keeps wearer protected from abrasions, jellyfish, etc. Keeps diver warm.

datum.name: Survival Kit, basic
datum.field: A fanny pack containing simple first aid supplies, two days of emergency rations, poncho, fishing supplies, knife, snare, matches, 100 feet of strong cord, signal mirror, magnifying lens, water purifying tablets, and basic medications.

datum.name: Survival Kit, full
datum.field: A backpack with enough gear to survive for a long time: first aid supplies, 15 days of mini-rations, knife, fishing supplies, snare, guidebook to animals plants, 4 days of water, water filter, compass, flashlight, signal equipment, flare launcher, matches, assorted drugs, compact sleeping blanket, battery powered radio, and a .22 caliber gun with 200 rounds.

datum.name: T-shirt
datum.field: A type of shirt made from cotton or a cotton-polyblend with short or long sleeves; no collar and simplified construction.

datum.name: Tao Tieh Pendant
datum.field: A small stone pendant carved with a YinYang. The size of a quarter of black-granite. Part is inlaid with mother-of-pearl. The back is engraved with eight Tao hexagrams in an octagonal pattern inlaid in gold. There is a crude fiber cord attached to the pendant.

datum.name: Tent, expedition
datum.field: High quality tent will stand up to the worst weather conditions. Fits 3 adults max.

datum.name: Tent, large
datum.field: A big cabinstyle tent. Has lots of room inside, up to 8 adults.

datum.name: Tent, small
datum.field: A small tent. Will fit two adults max.

datum.name: Tent, survival
datum.field: A tiny tent large enough for one person. Fits into a pants pocket!

datum.name: Tool kit- advanced
datum.field: Large tool kit for working on machinery, vehicles, or mecha. Fits in a large rolling chest or small trailer. Has many special tools such as a large jack, extra-large wrench set for big jobs, portable engine hoist, small air compressor, metal and wood cutting saws, powered wrench, gas torch, etc.

datum.name: Tool kit- basic
datum.field: A portable pouch with the basics: Hammer, screwdrivers, adjustable wrench, pliers, measuring tape, and a small saw

datum.name: Tool kit- standard
datum.field: A big tool box filled with a large assortment of tools. Weighs about 70 lbs. Good for most basic jobs.

datum.name: Tool, Halligan
datum.field: Firefighter's tool. A single piece of metal that has a hammer, axe, hydrant wrench, and a special prying edge. It can be used to force open doors, etc.

datum.name: Tool, MultiTool
datum.field: A pocket tool similar to a swiss army knife. It has common tools inside, like pliers, screwdriver, knife blade, etc. Very handy, but not tough enough for serious jobs or manuverable enough for delicate work.

datum.name: Tool, Rescue
datum.field: 2-in-1 tool. Used to break car windshields and cut seatbelts/clothing. Cannot be used as a weapon.

datum.name: Utensil
datum.field: Any eating utensil such as a spoon, fork, knife or chopstick.

datum.name: Wagon
datum.field: A large four-wheeled cart, possibly enclosed. Can accomodate one or two draft animals.

datum.name: Wagon, Ox
datum.field: A very large wagon that can accomodate a team of Oxen, like a regular wagon, but much larger.

datum.name: Wagon, Postal Carrier
datum.field: A wagon with a light-weight steel undercarriage with wicker-work and canvas top. The top is oiled and made from doubled-egypt cloth and is therefore weather proof. A Postal Carrier weighs approximately 14 of an equivalently sized wagon, but uses the same number of draft animals. It can maintain twice the speed of a normal wagon.

datum.name: Wagon, Team
datum.field: A wagon which can accomodate a team of draft animals. Teams come in even numbers; for example, this type of wagon can accomodate teams of 2,4,6, or 8 draft animals.

datum.name: Warhorse
datum.field: A "normal" warhorse is much larger than a regular horse, being around 1300 lbs. Only warhorses can be used in combat.

datum.name: Warhorse, Furious
datum.field: These are the largest of the Warhorses, weighing in at 1500 or more pounds. They are known for extreme (and violent) attachment to a single rider and will literally attempt to kill any others attempting to ride them. Furies are the strongest, fastest, and most durable of all the Warhorses.

datum.name: Warhorse, Heavy
datum.field: A breed of Warhorse used by mounted and heavily armored soldiers. These Warhorses are not much bigger than a normal Warhorse, but are much stronger. They are typically slower but have greater endurance. Only warhorses can be used in combat.

datum.name: Warhorse, King's Own
datum.field: A subbreed of the Furious, the King's Own is a slightly lighter, but much faster horse than the Furious. They are trained to be able to handle two riders. Only warhorses can be used in combat.

datum.name: Warhorse, Light
datum.field: A smaller horse bred for speed and ferocity. Only warhorses can be used in combat.

datum.name: Watch, Calculator
datum.field: A wristwatch with a built-in calculator.

datum.name: Watch, standard
datum.field: Tells the time. That's about it.

datum.name: Watch, survival
datum.field: A heavy-duty watch that's nearly indestructible. Waterproof, has built in compass, thermometer, and other features.

datum.name: Blow Gun - Long
datum.field: A hollow tube, fashioned from wood or metal, which is used to shoot small darts by means of blowing into one end. Blowguns deal very low damage intrinsically, but are very effective for delivering poisons to the target. Many primitive tribes rely on the silent attack of the blowgun to hunt animals for food.

datum.name: Bolo
datum.field: A simple tool used for capturing animals. The bolo is a bundle of long cords tied together in a common knot. The free ends of the cords are tipped with weights. The bolo is whirled around the head and then thrownupon striking, the cords are likely to entangle the target's legs. Though not thought of as a common weapon of war, bolos have been used in combat, and can be very useful.

datum.name: Composite Bow
datum.field: A composite bow is one that is made from multiple layers of wood that are glued together. It also has a semi-recurve design. This creates a bow that is significantly more durable and more powerful than a smaller bow. They are about 4..5 feet long.

datum.name: Compound Bow
datum.field: A modern variation of the archaic bow. The compound bow has a pulley system attached to the string, which provides increased velocity. They generally have a very high draw weight, but are designed so that once they are pulled back, the weight the shooter has to hold while aiming is far less than the actual power of the bow. Though some archaic bows are more powerful, the compound bow is much more durable and more compact.

datum.name: Crossbow - Heavy
datum.field: A bow made from iron equipped with a gun-like trigger assembly for firing. Crossbows range in size from the small pistol-sized ones through larger ones used for hunting and war, through the largest sizes, which are so powerful they require a mechanical crank to cock them. Crossbows always require one action or more to load. Modern crossbows are made from composite materials, and even the larger sizes are fairly light and easily carried.

datum.name: Crossbow - Pellet, hand
datum.field: Always deals P damage. Bullets are 1 each

datum.name: Crossbow - Pellet, large
datum.field: Always deals P damage. Bullets are 1 each

datum.name: Crossbow - Repeating
datum.field: takes 2 hands to reload, but 1 to fire.

datum.name: Hunters Bow
datum.field: A variant of the short bow optimized for hunting. It is of similar size, but is made of more flexible wood and has a larger draw length. It is designed so that it is powerful, but isn't too large to carry while stalking game. This bow can kill larger deer, antelope, etc.

datum.name: Long Bow
datum.field: A much heavier bow developed by the English. A true Long bow is made from Yew wood, and is at least six feet long. When equipped with the proper arrows, it can penetrate full plate armor.

datum.name: Recurve Bow
datum.field: A recurve bow is one that has been specially treated so that the bow itself wants to bend in the opposite direction that it actually does when drawn. This puts more force on the bowstring therefore equates to a more powerful bow.

datum.name: Short Bow
datum.field: A common bow used for hunting, target shooting, or combat. The short bow is generally four feet long. It can be used to hunt animals weighing less than a man.

datum.name: Sling
datum.field: The weapon used by David to slay Goliath. A sling is a simple leather or cloth strip with a pocket in the center. The pocket is loaded with a stone, or other object, and the sling is whirled about the head and released, sending the stone flying at high speed. Slings deal decent damage, and are very simple to create. They are often used to harass enemy troops, or to launch various nasty substances into enemy ranks.

datum.name: Slingshot
datum.field: A very simple modern weapon. The slingshot is a Y-shaped frame, often made from wood, into which a thick rubber band has been mounted. The slingshot is held in one hand, while the other hand loads the band with your choice of missile, and stretches it back, then firing. Slingshots are so simple children often make them. Professionally made slingshots, which fire metal balls, can be quite powerful, and can kill in the proper hands. They are effective for hunting small game.

datum.name: Air Laser
datum.field: This spell fires a thin beam of compressed gas and wind from the caster's outstretched hand. The beam is very hard to see becasue it looks like a hazy distortion in the airit is very nearly transparent. The beam may be fired at any target within 100 feet range. Air Laser has AP: 50 and is at a +3 to strike. Note: this spell is not actually a laser in the true sense of the word, thus it is not affected by typical laser defenses.

datum.name: Air Scythe
datum.field: The caster enchants a bit of air surrounding one target, forming it into an invisible cutting blade. The blade automatically strikes the target. This spell is only effective if the intended target is surrounded by air. It is ineffective in an air-free enviornment, such as in space or underwater.

datum.name: Ball lightning
datum.field: The caster charges a ball of electricity between his hands and then throws it forward in a direction of his choosing. The ball travels in a straight line from the caster towards its intended target. The ball can travel no more than 150 feet away, or to the intended target, whichever is closer. The ball explodes into a flash of lightning and sparks whenever it strikes its intended target or reaches its maximum range in the event of a miss. This deals 1105U damage to the target and anything occupying the target square. This spell does not have the Fire effect though it will ignite readily flammible materials in the target square. Furthermore, any creature that is within 10 feet of the path the ball travels (except the caster) is struck by a small lightning bolt dealiong 1102 damage. (roll this damage seperatley for each target harmed in this manner) The final target does not suffer this damage in addition to the normal target damage. The caster may throw the ball through hard objects or through "friendly" targets by making the ball disappear and reappear along its path. The ball can pass though inaninmate objects or open areas 15' or less in size and then reappear without stopping it or diminishing it's effect on the target if the caster makes a magical control check for each object or space he wishes the ball to skip.

datum.name: Call Lightning
datum.field: Caster calls down a single lighting bolt from the sky, which strikes the target. It has a 50chance of fire effect. This spell is only effective outdoors. If this spell is cast on a stormy day, it deals double damage and the caster gets +3 to his strike roll.

datum.name: Chain Lightning
datum.field: The caster fires a bolt of lightning from his outstretched arms. The bolt automatically strikes one target, dealing 1105 damage. The bolt then immedietly jumps to another target within 40 feet of the first, dealing 4x 110 , etc. The bolt keeps jumping, each time losing 1x damage. The bolt jumps four times for a total of five different strikes. Chain Lightning can jump to the same target more than once, as long as the target wasn't the target of the previous strike. Each lightning jump always strikes the closest possible target from its previous jump, unless the caster makes a Magical Control check to redirect it elsewhere at -1 for each 5 feet between the closest target and the caster's preferred target.

datum.name: Corona
datum.field: The caster conjures up a field of intense lightning energy, fire, and sparks which fills one 5-foot square (which must be a valid target) and four surrounding squares (a cross shape). Anything in the area of effect of the spell suffers 2105U per turn for the duration of the spell. Also, on each of the caster's turns one randomly determined target within 20' of the area of effect is struck by a lightning bolt dealing 310U.

datum.name: Create Smoke
datum.field: Generates a large cloud of dense black-gray smoke filling 50,000 cubic feet. (50x50x20), which then dissipates naturally. This smoke is not hazardous or unpleasant to breathe, though it does obscure vision.

datum.name: Deflection
datum.field: Deflection enchants one target with a field of anti-gravity. This has the following effects on the target: +3 levels to dodge skill (and similar skills based on dodge) +3 to any DEX or skill rolls related to jumping or avoiding objects. +2 levels to parry +2 levels to block (shield skill) -6 to strike with melee attacks -3 to other types of DEX checks or skills involving manual dexterity or manipulation of small objects.

datum.name: Electric Bolt
datum.field: Caster forms a small bolt of lighting in his/her hands and sends it flying towards any one target. (has a 50chance of fire effect)

datum.name: Electrospark
datum.field: Caster manipulates air molecules to create an electrostatic discharge wherever he chooses. It doesn't have fire effect, but it can ignite very flammable materials such as gasoline, lamp oil, dry tinder, natural gas, etc. Target must be within 20' of caster. Caster can use touch to strike with the spell automatically.

datum.name: Energy Field
datum.field: Generates an area of highly charged air. Electronic devices in the field such as appliances, cellular phones, computers, or walkie-talkies have 60chance to fail in operation. Furthermore, static electricity in the area will move about lightweight objects and fine particles are likely to become stuck to anything moving in the area.

datum.name: Explodet
datum.field: A powerful spell that forces the air immediately surrounding one target to undergo immediate and complete mass-energy transformation, creating a powerful explosion with the target inside it. X is the size of the target.

datum.name: Focused Gust
datum.field: Creates a short gust of wind in a random direction centered at a location the caster chooses. It applies force equal to 10*X*Y lbs. Y is the size level of the object the spell is cast on. If the caster spends double MP he can choose the direction of the gust. This spell cannot cause damage directly, but can knock things over.

datum.name: Gas Slash
datum.field: One target is struck by several narrow streamers of high pressure gas. Target is struck a total of X times. Reroll damage for each strike.

datum.name: Grand Storm
datum.field: After casting, a dark, foreboding, storm blows into the region. For the duration of the spell, the caster can spend one action to call down from the sky a bolt of lightning dealing 31010U damage to any target that is outside; all objects within 10 feet of the target take half damage from this strike. In addition, for the duration of the spell the caster can take an action to throw a bolt of lightning from his fingers dealing 1105U damage to the target, and all objects that are lined up behind the target for up to 50 feet.

datum.name: Great Bolt
datum.field: The caster calls down a large bolt of lightning from the sky, striking one target. (fire effect). Anything within 5' of the strike takes half damage. This only works outdoors.

datum.name: Heavy Spark
datum.field: Caster launches a bolt of lightning from his/her outstretched hands, which attacks a single target.

datum.name: Invert pressure
datum.field: Invokes a gas explosion within the target

datum.name: Lightning Gauntlet
datum.field: One of the caster's forearm and hand is surrounded by a sheath of electricity. Anything the caster touches with the gauntlet takes listed damage. Due to the size of the gauntlet, the caster gets a +1 to strike with it (use unarmed combat, or similar skill to strike).

datum.name: Lightning Stream
datum.field: A large column of lightning streams out from the caster. The stream can be a maximum of 100 feet long, and deals 1105U damage to all that are caught within the stream. Only large, inorganic, nonmetallic objects (e.g. stone wall, hill, etc.) can stop the lightning stream. For the duration of the spell, the caster can use an action to re-point the spell so that it can damage a different set of opponents.

datum.name: Pressure shift
datum.field: Caster disassociates ambient air along a common plane, centered at the target, producing a devastating crushing blow within the target

datum.name: Sandstorm
datum.field: A more powerful version of whirlwind. Area affect: 10'x10'

datum.name: Spark Shower
datum.field: One target is barraged by thousands of high-voltage sparks emanating from all surrounding matter dealing damage and catching the target on fire. (Fire effect)

datum.name: Web Lightning
datum.field: A bolt of lightning streaks out from each finger of the caster's primary hand, for a total of 5 bolts. Each one is treated as if it was the level 4 spell Chain Lightning.

datum.name: Whirlwind
datum.field: Creates a small whirlwind that strikes one target, slashing at it with airborne stones and other particles.

datum.name: Willy-Willy
datum.field: Creates a small cyclone about 6-10 feet high. Deals no damage, but can move objects weighing less than 20 lbs. GM should determine skill check, if any, to perform special manipulation of the object. The cyclone can move things around but it cannot perform careful manipulation , etc. Can also blow around dirt, fan flames, etc. Creatures inside the cyclone require a dex check at -4 to remain standing.

datum.name: Wind Screen
datum.field: Generates a circular wall (as Wind Wall), ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, of fast-moving air surrounding the caster. (HP=300)

datum.name: Wind Shear
datum.field: Tosses one target into the air, where it is torn apart by strong crosswinds. If the target is wearing armor there is a 75chance that it will be destroyed if it is soft armor, 25chance if it is hard. The armor does protect against the damage of the spell.

datum.name: Wind Wall
datum.field: Creates a large wall of swirling air, three feet thick, 50 feet x 25 feet in size. The wall has 200 HP. It is damaged normally by explosions or air, or physical magic. It takes half damage from fire and no damage from other sources. The wall is oriented as the caster wishes, but one edge must be on the ground. Things can pass 1' through the wall per action, if they pass a STR check at -3*size.

datum.name: Advanced Haste
datum.field: Up to 4 targets gains 1 action per turn

datum.name: Advanced Slow
datum.field: Up to 4 targets loose 1 action per turn. Remember that any combatant can never have less than 1 action per turn.

datum.name: Anti-Magic Cloud
datum.field: The caster summons a dark purple cloud into existence that is a mile in radius centered on the caster. If anyone, not including the caster, attempts to cast a spell when under the cloud, a bolt of anti-magic strikes the person attempting the spell. If a target is struck by this anti-magic they must make a WIL check at a -10, or take damage equal to the MP cost of the spell cast divided by 5, and fail the casting of their spell.

datum.name: Autolevitation
datum.field: Caster may raise and lower his body (vertical direction only, 10 mph)

datum.name: Dark Servant
datum.field: Caster creates a magical copy of any one target, as Shadow Servant. It has armor HP equivalent to the target. It vanishes if it's HP goes negative. Copy cannot, however, use any defensive skills, dodge, etc.

datum.name: Destroy Barrier
datum.field: Destroys any one magical barrier or field-effect spell

datum.name: Dimensional Shift
datum.field: Caster removes target creature from this dimension. Caster must win willpower contest with target in order to be successful. (caster gets +1 to his WIL in this contest per 100 extra MP spent)

datum.name: Disenchant
datum.field:
Disenchant is used to remove magical effects from an object or area. Each casting of Disenchant affects a single magical spell or effect. If disenchant is used on a spell of3rdrank or lower, then the targeted spell effect instantly expires (stops). If disenchant is used on a spell of4thrank or higher, then the spell may or may not be affected. In this case the caster of Disenchant enters a contest of skills (Magical Control) with the original caster of the existing spell, with the following conditions:
The Original caster of the spell (even if he is deceased) rolls Magical Control using the statistics he had at the time the original spell was first cast. Furthermore, he adds the rank of that spell to his roll.
The caster of disenchant rolls Magical Control using his current statistics. Furthermore, he may add +1 to his roll for each 50 MP spent beyond the original casting cost of Disenchant.
If the original caster wins the contest, the original spell remains in effect, unchanged. If the disenchant caster wins the contest, the original spell instantly stops functioning. In both cases the caster of disenchant looses the MP spent.Bratzner attempts to disenchantFive years ago Ulek the Pious cast Major Ward on a lockbox containing some scrolls. Now, having slain Ulek, an evil wizard, Bratzner wishes to disenchant Major Ward so that he can open the box unharmed. Because Major Ward is5thrank, Disenchant does not automatically work, and a skill contest is required. Even though Ulek is dead, he is still entitled to a roll. The GM determines that Ulek had Magical Control level 4 and WIL 15 at the time Major Ward was first cast. Thus, Uleks roll is 4 dice + 15 (from wisdom) and +5 from the spell level. The GM keeps this information secret, and rolls for Ulek: Three successes. The evil wizard now rolls: He has Lvl 5 Magical Control, a WIL of 14, and he chooses to spend an extra 250 MP which gives him +5 to his roll. His roll is 5 dice + 19, and comes up four successes. Because the evil wizard wins the skill contest, disenchant is successful and Major Ward disappears.

datum.name: Enlighten
datum.field: One target receives +2 to all attributes for the duration of the spell

datum.name: Field of Retribution

datum.name: Field of Silence

datum.name: Glorious Aura

datum.name: Halt Time

datum.name: Imprison

datum.name: Levitate Object
datum.field: Caster may raise and lower one physical object with a maximum mass of 40 lb (vertical direction only, 10 mph)

datum.name: Light Curtain
datum.field: One target receives +2 to all attributes for the duration of the spell. Target also receives double dice on all skill rolls. Target gets a +1 bonus to all damage rolls, and reduces damage of any incoming attacks by up to 10 points of damage.

datum.name: Mana Burn
datum.field: One target loses all their MP. They take damage equal to the amount of MP lost, divided by 5.

datum.name: Mana Drain-2
datum.field: No spells may be cast in within 30 feet

datum.name: Mana Sap
datum.field: One target loses 16 *20 MP which is transferred to the caster

datum.name: Mass Haste
datum.field: All desired targets within a 100 foot radius from some point desired by the caster gain 1 action per turn. Remember that a person cannot have less than 1 action per turn.

datum.name: Mass Silence
datum.field: Up to 4 targets cannot speak or cast magic for the duration of the spell

datum.name: Mass Slow
datum.field: All desired targets within a 100 foot radius from some point desired by the caster lose 1 action per turn. Remember that a person cannot have less than 1 action per turn.

datum.name: Minor Mana Sap
datum.field: Target loses 1610 MP which is transferred to the caster

datum.name: Negate
datum.field: One target may not cast any spells for the duration of Negate. If the target attempts to cast a spell, he must make a WIL check at -10. If successful, the caster casts the spell attempted. If the check fails, the caster takes undefined damage equal to the MP cost of the spell attempted divided by 5.

datum.name: Questioning
datum.field: Roll magical control. Caster may ask one humanoid target one yes/no question for each success which the target must answer truthfully. The caster may continue asking questions beyond that point, but target can then attempt to lie by passing a WIL check at -5.

datum.name: Quicken
datum.field: One target gets a bonus of + 24 to their initiative.

datum.name: Redirect Effect
datum.field: Redirect any aspects of a spell you cast to another target. This must be cast at the same time as another spell.

datum.name: Scan
datum.field: Allows the caster to determine the core statistics of any one target. (HP, skills, equipment possessed, etc.) If there is a perception test involving a scanned target, the caster recives +3 on the roll due to the benefits of this spell. Target must be within sight range and the caster must be aware of the target in order to cast.

datum.name: Sense magic
datum.field: Gives the caster an ability to instantly and accurately determine the magical nature of things within his vision. It does NOT imply knowledge of what the magic does, merely if it is magical or not. This spell can be useful for identifying illusions, as they always appear magical.

datum.name: Shadow Servant
datum.field: Caster creates a magical copy of any one target. Copy will stand beside target and will do whatever the target does (effectively doubling the actions of target) If shadow takes any damage (even one point!and it has NO armor) it vanishes, dealing 26U to the original target.

datum.name: Silence
datum.field: One target cannot speak or cast magic for the duration of the spell

datum.name: Simple Mana Drain
datum.field: All spells cast within 30 feet radius cast without gems/stones require double MP to cast

datum.name: Slow
datum.field: Target loses 1 action per turn. Remember that any combatant can never have less than 1 action per turn.

datum.name: Strengthen
datum.field: One target receives +2 to all physical attributes for the duration of the spell

datum.name: Tainted Mana
datum.field: Area effect of 30 feet. All targets in the area suffer 14 * (X/5) U damage, except the caster.

datum.name: True Flight
datum.field: Caster gains magical flight. Max speed = 30 MPH.

datum.name: Twink
datum.field: Adds + 16-1 to target's attributes, divided how caster chooses but cannot make an attribute more than 20, and cannot be cast again on the same target until the effects wear off.

datum.name: Unbind
datum.field: Instantly removes all magical enchantment, etc. from one item, person, or area. Caster must expend additional MP equal to the total MP used in enchanting the item (or spell to be removed)

datum.name: Bolster Circle
datum.field: Caster may extend the duration of a Circle spell. +X D6 rounds

datum.name: Channel Summon
datum.field: Allows caster to add +X to his summon score.

datum.name: Circle Against Beasts
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Beasts must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Circle Against Constructs
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Constructs must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Circle Against Demons
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Demons must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Circle Against Monsters
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Monsters must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Circle Against Outsiders
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Outsiders must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Circle Against Undead
datum.field: Creates a circular marking on the floor/ground which is Summon Rank feet in diameter. Undead must pass a WIL contest vs. the caster in order to enter the circle, with the Caster at +5 to his roll.

datum.name: Command
datum.field: As gate, except that the summoned creature(s) follow complex and specific commands issued by the summoner. While this spell is in effect the creatures are assumed to have the mental attributes of the caster. The caster must remain motionless during this spell's duration. The caster effectivley controls the summoned creatures. (See Beast Magic rules)

datum.name: Communicate with Animals
datum.field: Allows caster to communicate mentally (similar to Telepathy) with animals

datum.name: Gate
datum.field: Summons one or more creatures to within sight range of the caster. Creatures maintain their own free will; they are merely transported to the new location. (See Beast Magic rules)

datum.name: Pact
datum.field: Cast on one target creature. Target becomes caster's familiar. Caster and Familiar have limited empathic ability. Familiar becomes loyal to the caster, and is bound to obey simple commands as summon. (See Beast Magic rules)

datum.name: Summon
datum.field: As gate, except that creatures summoned are bound to follow one very simple directive given by the caster. Example: Protect X, or Attack Y (See Beast Magic rules)

datum.name: Transform
datum.field: Caster transforms himself into an alternate form. Caster retains his own mental attributes but assumes the physical attributes, abilities, and form of the new creature. (See Beast Magic rules)

datum.name: Alter Size
datum.field: Caster may alter the size of one object +/- 100. This can only affect non-living targets. The target must be a single object; it cannot work on machines.

datum.name: Cataclysm
datum.field: Caster unleashes an unrelenting attack of flying, exploding, and falling stones on an area. Targets in the area are struck 16 times per size level. Each hit does the listed damage.

datum.name: Chasm
datum.field: Opens or closes a fissure in the ground, up to 15 feet long, 5 feet wide, 20 feet deep.

datum.name: Create Portal
datum.field: Creates a hole with radius 2 feet in earth, rock, brick, etc. (Max thickness = 2 feet)

datum.name: Create stone
datum.field: Caster creates a small (1/2 lb) stone in the palm of his hand. Can also be used to make a stone larger by 1/2 lb. The general shape can be controlled, but nothing detailed can be produced

datum.name: Crumble
datum.field: Caster can use his hands to crumble away stone, dirt, etc. as if it were soft (cake-like) in consistency. Caster can shape up to 5 cubic feet of stone before the spell wears off. Otherwise it will wear off in 16 minutes. The shaping performed by the caster is permanent. This spell cannot effect man-made materials like artificial stone or concrete.

datum.name: Dance of Stalagmites
datum.field: An area, 20 feet in radius around a point the caster chooses, is enchanted with growing stalagmites. Every turn, 24 stalagmites rapidly grow out of the ground, impaling anything above the area. These stalagmites can be targeted by the caster, and remain as permanent fixtures upon the ground once created. Each stalagmite must use the Roll to strike, and each deals the listed damage.

datum.name: Deformation
datum.field: One geographic area, up to 10 square miles, will start to deform into a type of terrain desired by the caster. The process takes 16 days, and can include movement, creation, or destruction of land masses; but not the living things in that area.

datum.name: Dustcloud
datum.field: Creates a cloud of sand, dust, and dirt in the air. The cloud will dissipate normally. The cloud measures no larger than 5' x 5' x 5' per X

datum.name: Earth to Stone
datum.field: A large quantity (3 cubic yards) of dirt is changed to hard stone

datum.name: Earthen Fist
datum.field: The caster creates a giant arm and hand of rocks and dirt, that rises out of the ground. The arm mimics the movement of the caster's arm and can strike or grapple targets. Use unarmed combat or similar skill to strike with. The arm has STR equal to the Caster's WIL times the number of succeses made on a Magical Control roll. The arm can stay in existance for 10 MP/turn.

datum.name: Earthen Maw
datum.field: Creates a huge mouth-like chasm (20' long, 10' deep, 6' wide) along the ground lined with sharp stone, under the target. Each turn the target is trapped within the maw, it suffers listed damage. Target can avoid the maw by making a DEX check at -10. To get out of the maw, the target must make a STR check at -10 vs. the caster's WIL +LVL of Magical Control.

datum.name: Fissure
datum.field: A 10 foot wide seismic fissure opens, trapping and crushing those who fall in. Creatures within the effect must make a DEX check at a -10 or fall into the fissure.

datum.name: Geo Press
datum.field: Creates a large mass of stone 10 feet in diameter held in the air above a target. It then falls, crushing the target and burying it underneath tons of earth.

datum.name: Geo Transport
datum.field: The ground swallows the caster and up to 1 ton of additional mass and instantly transports him to any location via underground. May only transport to/from and through areas of soil, rock, etc. Cannot pass through concrete, refined metals, wood, etc. All items to be transported must be within 10' of the caster.

datum.name: Greatly Alter Size
datum.field: Caster may alter the size of one object +/- 500. This can only affect non-living targets. The target must be a single object; it cannot work on machines.

datum.name: Invoke Quake
datum.field: The caster creates a small earthquake, causing large-scale seismic damage within 30 feet of the epicenter

datum.name: Manipulate Earth
datum.field: Allows the caster to sculpt structures out of naturally occurring rocks, dirt, etc. Caster may move up to 2 cubic yards of material. After the spell's duration unstable sections will collapse.

datum.name: Push
datum.field: Magically pushes a target away from the caster. The target is pushed a distance of (2000 / weight in lbs.) feet. The push travels directly away from the caster. This spell cannot deal damage intrinsically, but it can be used to push something down a hole or against a trap, etc.

datum.name: Rock Bomb
datum.field: Caster sends a nearby stone hurtling towards one target. When it gets near the target it explodes, sending razor-sharp shards flying in all directions.

datum.name: Rock Encasement
datum.field: A hard, stone-like layer coats one object that is no larger than 4 feet in any one dimension. Moving objects must be traveling less than 5 MPH. The rock layer is 1 inch thick.

datum.name: Rock Serpent
datum.field: Caster creates a snake-like living golem out of stone. It is controllable by the caster for the duration of the spell. It cannot dodge, but it can attack and parry with it's claws. Damage is 34+1S claws, 66+1C bite and 410C tail. It has 5 dice to attack and 3 actions/turn. Armor is equal to caster's WIL in all categories and has X HP.

datum.name: Rock to Mud
datum.field: A large quantity (3 cubic yards) of rock or concrete is changed into a loose, wet mud

datum.name: Rockslide
datum.field: Initiates the movement of dirt, stones, in the surrounding area into a giant wave that crashes into the target area. Deals a total of 6x 46C damage divided however the user chooses among up to 6 targets. Can only be used around suitable material for the spell. Can deal no more than 100 damage per size level of any one target.

datum.name: Screen of Stones
datum.field: Caster creates a thin wall of dirt, sand, and stones suspended in the air. Wall takes no damage from physical attacks. The wall can be struck X times, then it crumbles to dust. Wall can be oriented however the caster wishes, but must have a surface area no greater than 100 square feet. Wall has no effect versus energy weapons, purely magical/elemental attacks, or anything with AP.

datum.name: Seismic Wave
datum.field: Generates a foot-high wave of seismic activity that travels outward from the caster in all directions to a range of 25*X feet. Any objects struck by wave suffer damage. X can be no greater than his level of Magical Control. Permanent structures take quadruple damage.

datum.name: Stone Rain
datum.field: A single target and an area 5 feet in radius is barraged by thousands of small stones.

datum.name: Stone Sentry
datum.field: A statue, approximately 8 feet tall, rises from the ground and attacks any opponents that come near it. The statue has 10/10/10 armor and 200 HP. It has a reach of 15 feet with it's stone arms, and deals 46+1C damage. It has an attack and parry skill of a 5, and has 4 actions per turn.

datum.name: Stone Skin
datum.field: One target gains a layer of stone-like external armor. The stone armor cover's the targets own skin, and provides armor with values (2+X) / (2*X) / (1+X)

datum.name: Stoneform
datum.field: Caster transforms his body into a dense, hard stone. DEX becomes 10. Gain 30/30/20 armor and quadruple normal HP. Cannot use complex weapons (e.g. guns, high tech, etc.) STR becomes four times normal.

datum.name: Ashen cloud
datum.field: Generates a billowing cloud of ashes, smoke, and glowing embers filling a cube measuring 20' on a side. Anything in the cloud suffers 54U from the heat. Anyone who breathes in the cloud will take an additional 24U damage per turn. Remaining in the cloud longer than 1 turn will cause objects to set on fire (Fire effect). Cloud naturally dissipates after spell duration runs out.

datum.name: Burning Blade
datum.field: One archaic weapon is enhanced with magical fire. The fire does not harm the weapon itself. However, it will burn other objects that the weapon may touch. Adds Fire effect to the weapon and also a +2 bonus to the damage roll.

datum.name: Effigy
datum.field: The caster's body is burned to ash by consuming flame. For the duration of the spell the caster is immune to all physical and fire damage, though water spells deal double damage. Everything with 50 feet of the caster take 26U damage from the heat per turn; everything within 20 feet of the caster takes 66U damage per turn. Anything the caster touches (including what he's standing on) takes 56+3U damage. Any living object the caster touches must make a BLD check or be reduced to ashes. At the end of the spell's duration the caster's body is restored. If the caster dies before the duration expires, the caster detonates in a massive explosion dealing 56+1 x 5 U damage to everything within 50 feet.

datum.name: Extinguish Fire
datum.field: Caster may extinguish normal fire (Magical Control2square yards)

datum.name: Fireball
datum.field: Caster launches a fireball, which strikes the target and detonates. The exact target suffers double damage. Everything within 20 feet of the detonation takes standard damage.

datum.name: Fireblast
datum.field: a sizeable spear of flaming energy strikes the target (fire effect)

datum.name: Firestorm
datum.field: Several ( 34 ) flaming projectiles strike the target (fire effect) The entire spell does rated damage, not each projectile. This will ignite all flammable materials in/on the target

datum.name: Flame
datum.field: Creates a small flaming ball of energy. It can be thrown up to 50 feet away as though it were a rock, or it can be smacked against an opponent in a hand-to-hand attack. Fire effect

datum.name: Flame Shards
datum.field: The caster throws a 1D(4+X) burst of small fireballs at one target. Each does rated damage. (fire effect)

datum.name: Flame Shroud
datum.field: The caster's body is covered with magical fire. The caster his carried items suffer no damage, but anything contacting the fire suffers 24U damage. Caster also gains 4/4/4 Armor, and +4 to base armor.

datum.name: Flame Wall
datum.field: Creates a large wall of magical fire, 3 x 50 x 25 feet, oriented as the caster wishes. Anything passing through the wall suffers 64+1U damage (with fire effect). Cannot be cast on a living target.

datum.name: Flame Wave
datum.field: The caster creates a three-foot high wave of magical fire that travels out from the caster to a maximum range of 50 feet. +2 to strike. Will travel up, over down surfaces it contacts, but cannot bridge gaps, etc.

datum.name: Flame Whip
datum.field: A 20 foot long tendril of fire stretches from the caster's hand. For the duration of the spell, the caster can spend one action to make an attack with the whip, dealing listed damage. Use the caster's Magical Control skill to strike with a bonus of +2.

datum.name: Great Fireball
datum.field: This spell works as Fireball, except that the central 5' radius area suffers double damage. A 30' radius suffers standard damage, and half damage extends out to 50' radius. Areas have Fire effect X4, X2, and F respectively.

datum.name: Heat Item
datum.field: One inanimate object's temperature is increased by (100 / mass in Kg) degrees C.

datum.name: Hellstorm
datum.field: Tendrils of flame lash out from a point specified by the caster, showering the area with deadly flame. This will cause damage to any targets desired by the caster, even through fire-resistant armor. Fire will spread rapidly from ignited targets and can only be extinguished by magical or supernatural means. The fire will burn out naturally after 26 minutes. This spell can be stopped by forcefields or similar high-tech defenses, or magic.

datum.name: Living Fire
datum.field: Auto, Roll to strike with the spears

The caster is enveloped in tendrils of fire. If any opponent comes within 15 feet of the caster, the fire surrounding the caster will lash out with a spear of fire, dealing listed damage. Each turn that target is within 15 feet of the caster, that target will be struck again.

datum.name: Magma Fountain
datum.field: A geyser of molten rock erupts from the ground under one target, which suffers the listed damage. All objects within 20 feet of the eruption will be splashed with lava, sustaining half damage and suffering Fire Effect x3 for the next 24 turns. All armor within the area of effect lose 14 to all armor values per turn. Damage cannot be prevented by fire resistant armor. This spell can be stopped by forcefields or similar high-tech defenses, or magic.

datum.name: Magma dart
datum.field: Caster forms and throws a deadly missile of pressurized, molten stone at any one target. Target suffers full damage. Upon impact, the dart emits a blast of heat dealing half damage to all objects within 10 feet. Items hit by this spell are severely damaged from the heat. If armor is hit, it will have all armor values reduced by 14 until repaired. Even heat-resistant armor, etc, has half effectiveness.

datum.name: Meteor
datum.field: Summons a small flaming meteor that launches at one target dealing 66+1U fire damage, and 66+3C damage. All objects within 20 yards radius suffers half damage from the fire. Damage can only be prevented by rank 6 or higher magical barrier or supernatural immunity to fire. An area of 20 yards around the impact will burn for the duration of the spell dealing 34+1U fire damage to all objects.

datum.name: Ray of Heat
datum.field: Caster projects a deadly beam of heat from his outstretched hand. The beam ignores energy defenses such as forcefields, as well as armor with the fire-resistant property. The target will ignite even if fireproof, etc. Only magical fire resistance, magical barriers, or extremely large non-flammable solid objects are proof against this spell.

datum.name: Red Arrow
datum.field: Creates an arrow-like dart of blazing fire which flies towards one target. This spell does not have Fire effect.

datum.name: Resist Fire
datum.field: One target gains permanent fire protection (cannot be set on fire) sustains half damage from fire or heat-based sources.

datum.name: Ring of Fire
datum.field: Generates a circular wall, ten feet in radius, three feet thick, thirty feet high, of flames surrounding the caster. Anything passing through the wall suffers 64+1U damage.

datum.name: Soak Fire
datum.field: Caster touches any kind of flame or fire that happens to be nearby while spell is active and coverts the heat into life energy. The caster GAINS 16 HP/turn for normal fire or 18+1 for intense/magical fire. The caster can soak a fire-based attack/spell with a successful magical control check with a - equal to the rank of the attack/spell. Upon succeeding the caster gains HP equal to half the spell's damage. On failing the caster suffers half normal damage instead.

datum.name: Spark
datum.field: Caster snaps his fingers producing sparks and a small lighter-like flame. Fire effect. The flame can be maintained by spending 5 MP per minute. Producing the flame will not harm the caster.

datum.name: Animate
datum.field: Brings one dead humanoid or animal back to life. Requires a reasonably intact corpse. Target has full HP, but suffers -2 to all attributes. Target is considered undead. Every 24 hours that pass causes the target to loose 1 WIL point. When WIL drops to zero target becomes a Zombie. Target can be restored to normal if Regrowth, Purify, and Purge are cast on the target.before WIL runs out.

datum.name: Antidote
datum.field: Instantly nullifies all foreign chemicals in one target: good AND bad. This affects drugs of any sort, poisions (ingested or otherwise), venom or posion from bites or stings, and so forth. Make a Magical Control check to see if the spell effects posions of a magical nature. This spell has no effect against living creatures or infectious organisms such as bacteria/diseases/viruses.
